     108              : /*
     109              :  * We chose the blending color space based upon the process color model of the
     110              :  * output device.  For gray, RGB, CMYK, or CMYK+spot devices, the choice is
     111              :  * usually simple.  For other devices or if the user is doing custom color
     112              :  * processing then the user may want to control this choice.
     113              :  */
     114              : #define AUTO_USE_CUSTOM_BLENDING 0
     115              : #define ALWAYS_USE_CUSTOM_BLENDING 1
     116              : #define DO_NOT_USE_CUSTOM_BLENDING 2
     117              : 
     118              : #define CUSTOM_BLENDING_MODE AUTO_USE_CUSTOM_BLENDING
     119              : 
     120              : # define INCR(v) DO_NOTHING

     590              : 
     591              : /*
     592              :  * The 'custom' PDF 1.4 compositor device is for working with those devices
     593              :  * which support spot colors but do not have a CMYK process color model.
     594              :  *
     595              :  * This causes some problems with the Hue, Saturation, Color, and Luminosity
     596              :  * blending modes.  These blending modes are 'non separable' and depend upon
     597              :  * knowing the details of the blending color space.  However we use the
     598              :  * process color model of the output device for our blending color space.
     599              :  * With an unknown process color model, we have to fall back to some 'guesses'
     600              :  * about how to treat these blending modes.
     601              :  */
     602              : const pdf14_device gs_pdf14_custom_device = {
     603              :     std_device_part1_(pdf14_device,
     604              :                       pdf14_custom_initialize_device_procs,
     605              :                       "pdf14custom",
     606              :                       &st_pdf14_device,
     607              :                       open_init_closed),
     608              :     dci_values(GX_DEVICE_COLOR_MAX_COMPONENTS,64,255,255,256,256),
     609              :     std_device_part2_(XSIZE, YSIZE, X_DPI, Y_DPI),
     610              :     offset_margin_values(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0),
     611              :     std_device_part3_(),
     612              :     { 0 },                      /* Procs */
     613              :     NULL,                       /* target */
     614              :     /* DeviceN parameters */
     615              :     { 8,                        /* Not used - Bits per color */
     616              :       DeviceCMYKComponents,     /* Names of color model colorants */
     617              :       4,                        /* Number colorants for CMYK */
     618              :       0,                        /* MaxSeparations has not been specified */
     619              :       -1,                       /* PageSpotColors has not been specified */
     620              :       {0},                      /* SeparationNames */
     621              :       0,                        /* SeparationOrder names */
     622              :       {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 } /* Initial component SeparationOrder */
     623              :     },
     624              :     &custom_pdf14_procs,
     625              :     &custom_blending_procs,
     626              :     4
     627              : };
     628              : 
     629              : /* Devices used for pdf14-accum-* device, one for  each image colorspace, */
     630              : /* Gray, RGB, CMYK, DeviceN. Before calling gdev_prn_open, the following  */
     631              : /* are set from the target device: width, height, xdpi, ydpi, MaxBitmap.  */
     632              :

     778            0 : ENUM_PTRS_WITH(pdf14_device_enum_ptrs, pdf14_device *pdev)

     787              : }

     811              : 
     812              : /* ------ Private definitions ------ */
     813              : 
     814              : static void
     815            0 : resolve_matte(pdf14_buf *maskbuf, byte *src_data, intptr_t src_planestride, intptr_t src_rowstride,
     816              :               int width, int height, cmm_profile_t *src_profile, int deep)
     817              : {
     818            0 :     if (deep) {
     819            0 :         int x, y, i;
     820            0 :         uint16_t *mask_row_ptr  = (uint16_t *)maskbuf->data;
     821            0 :         uint16_t *src_row_ptr   = (uint16_t *)src_data;
     822            0 :         uint16_t *mask_tr_fn    = (uint16_t *)maskbuf->transfer_fn;
     823              : 
     824            0 :         src_planestride >>= 1;
     825            0 :         src_rowstride >>= 1;
     826              : 
     827            0 :         for (y = 0; y < height; y++) {
     828              :             uint16_t *mask_curr_ptr = mask_row_ptr;
     829              :             uint16_t *src_curr_ptr = src_row_ptr;
     830            0 :             for (x = 0; x < width; x++) {
     831            0 :                 uint16_t idx = *mask_curr_ptr;
     832            0 :                 byte     top = idx>>8;
     833            0 :                 uint16_t a   = mask_tr_fn[top];
     834            0 :                 int      b   = mask_tr_fn[top+1]-a;
     835            0 :                 uint16_t matte_alpha = a + ((0x80 + b*(idx & 0xff))>>8);
     836              : 
     837              :                 /* matte's happen rarely enough that we allow ourselves to
     838              :                  * resort to 64bit here. */
     839            0 :                 if (matte_alpha != 0 && matte_alpha != 0xffff) {
     840            0 :                     for (i = 0; i < src_profile->num_comps; i++) {
     841            0 :                         int val = src_curr_ptr[i * src_planestride] - maskbuf->matte[i];
     842            0 :                         int temp = (((int64_t)val) * 0xffff / matte_alpha) + maskbuf->matte[i];
     843              : 
     844              :                         /* clip */
     845            0 :                         if (temp > 0xffff)
     846            0 :                             src_curr_ptr[i * src_planestride] = 0xffff;
     847            0 :                         else if (temp < 0)
     848            0 :                             src_curr_ptr[i * src_planestride] = 0;
     849              :                         else
     850            0 :                             src_curr_ptr[i * src_planestride] = temp;
     851              :                     }
     852              :                 }
     853            0 :                 mask_curr_ptr++;
     854            0 :                 src_curr_ptr++;
     855              :             }
     856            0 :             src_row_ptr += src_rowstride;
     857            0 :             mask_row_ptr += (maskbuf->rowstride>>1);
     858              :         }

     876              :                         /* clip */

     892            0 : }
     893              : 
     894              : /* Transform of color data and copy noncolor data.  Used in
     895              :    group pop and during the pdf14 put image calls when the blend color space
     896              :    is different than the target device color space.  The function will try do
     897              :    in-place conversion if possible.  If not, it will do an allocation.  The
     898              :    put_image call needs to know if an allocation was made so that it can adjust
     899              :    for the fact that we likely don't have a full page any longer and we don't
     900              :    need to do the offset to our data in the buffer. Bug 700686: If we are in
     901              :    a softmask that includes a matte entry, then we need to undo the matte
     902              :    entry here at this time in the image's native color space not the parent
     903              :    color space.   The endian_swap term here is only set to true if the data
     904              :    has been baked as BE during the put_image blending operation and we are
     905              :    on a LE machine.  */
     906              : static forceinline pdf14_buf*
     907            0 : template_transform_color_buffer(gs_gstate *pgs, pdf14_ctx *ctx, gx_device *dev,
     908              :     pdf14_buf *src_buf, byte *src_data, cmm_profile_t *src_profile,

    1031              : 
    1032              : /* This is a routine to do memset's but with 16 bit values.
    1033              :  * Note, that we still take bytes, NOT "num values to set".
    1034              :  * We assume dest is 16 bit aligned. We assume that bytes is
    1035              :  * a multiple of 2. */
    1036            0 : static void gs_memset16(byte *dest_, uint16_t value, int bytes)
    1037              : {
    1038            0 :     uint16_t *dest = (uint16_t *)(void *)dest_;
    1039            0 :     uint32_t v;
    1040            0 :     if (bytes < 0)
    1041              :         return;
    1042            0 :     if (((intptr_t)dest) & 2) {
    1043            0 :         *dest++ = value;
    1044            0 :         bytes--;
    1045            0 :         if (bytes == 0)
    1046              :             return;
    1047              :     }
    1048            0 :     v = value | (value<<16);
    1049            0 :     bytes -= 2;
    1050            0 :     while (bytes > 0) {
    1051            0 :         *(uint32_t *)dest = v;
    1052            0 :         dest += 2;
    1053            0 :         bytes -= 4;
    1054              :     }
    1055            0 :     bytes += 2;
    1056            0 :     if (bytes & 2) {
    1057            0 :         *dest = value;
    1058              :     }
    1059              : }

    1281              : /**
    1282              :  * pdf14_find_backdrop_buf: Find backdrop buffer.
    1283              :  *
    1284              :  * Return value: Backdrop buffer for current group operation, or NULL
    1285              :  * if backdrop is fully transparent.
    1286              :  **/
    1287              : static  pdf14_buf *
    1288            0 : pdf14_find_backdrop_buf(pdf14_ctx *ctx, bool *is_backdrop)
    1289              : {
    1290              :     /* Our new buffer is buf */
    1291            0 :     pdf14_buf *buf = ctx->stack;
    1292              : 
    1293            0 :     *is_backdrop = false;
    1294              : 
    1295            0 :     if (buf != NULL) {
    1296              :         /* If the new buffer is isolated there is no backdrop */
    1297            0 :         if (buf->isolated) return NULL;
    1298              : 
    1299              :         /* If the previous buffer is a knockout group
    1300              :            then we need to use its backdrop as the backdrop. If
    1301              :            it was isolated then that back drop was NULL */

    1303              :             /* Per the spec, if we have a non-isolated group
    1304              :                in a knockout group the non-isolated group
    1305              :                uses the backdrop of its parent group (the knockout group)
    1306              :                as its own backdrop.  The non-isolated group must
    1307              :                go through the standard re-composition operation
    1308              :                to avoid the double application of the backdrop */
    1309            0 :             *is_backdrop = true;
    1310            0 :             return buf->saved;
    1311              :         }
    1312              :         /* This should be the non-isolated case where its parent is
    1313              :            not a knockout */
    1314              :         if (buf->saved != NULL) {
    1315              :             return buf->saved;
    1316              :         }
    1317              :     }
    1318              :     return NULL;
    1319              : }

    1461              : static  int
    1462            0 : pdf14_push_transparency_group(pdf14_ctx *ctx, gs_int_rect *rect, bool isolated,

    1560            0 :                buf->planestride * buf->n_planes);

    1583              : 
    1584              : static  int
    1585            0 : pdf14_pop_transparency_group(gs_gstate *pgs, pdf14_ctx *ctx,
    1586              :     const pdf14_nonseparable_blending_procs_t * pblend_procs,
    1587              :     int tos_num_color_comp, cmm_profile_t *curr_icc_profile, gx_device *dev)
    1588              : {
    1589            0 :     pdf14_buf *tos = ctx->stack;
    1590            0 :     pdf14_buf *nos = tos->saved;
    1591            0 :     pdf14_mask_t *mask_stack = tos->mask_stack;
    1592            0 :     pdf14_buf *maskbuf;
    1593            0 :     int x0, x1, y0, y1;
    1594            0 :     int nos_num_color_comp;
    1595            0 :     bool no_icc_match;
    1596            0 :     pdf14_device *pdev = (pdf14_device *)dev;
    1597            0 :     bool overprint = pdev->overprint;
    1598            0 :     gx_color_index drawn_comps = pdev->drawn_comps_stroke | pdev->drawn_comps_fill;

    1600            0 :     int code = 0;
    1601              : 
    1602              : #ifdef DEBUG
    1603              :     pdf14_debug_mask_stack_state(ctx);
    1604              : #endif
    1605            0 :     if (mask_stack == NULL) {
    1606              :         maskbuf = NULL;
    1607              :     }
    1608              :     else {
    1609            0 :         maskbuf = mask_stack->rc_mask->mask_buf;
    1610              :     }
    1611              : 
    1612            0 :     if (maskbuf != NULL && maskbuf->matte != NULL)
    1613            0 :         has_matte = true;
    1614              : 
    1615              :     /* Check if this is our last buffer, if yes, there is nothing to
    1616              :        compose to.  Keep this buffer until we have the put image.
    1617              :        If we have another group push, this group must be destroyed.
    1618              :        This only occurs sometimes when at clist creation time
    1619              :        push_shfill_group occured and nothing was drawn in this group.
    1620              :        There is also the complication if we have a softmask.  There
    1621              :        are two approaches to this problem.  Apply the softmask during
    1622              :        the put image or handle it now.  I choose the later as the
    1623              :        put_image code is already way to complicated. */
    1624            0 :     if (nos == NULL && maskbuf == NULL) {
    1625            0 :         tos->group_popped = true;
    1626            0 :         return 0;
    1627              :     }
    1628              : 
    1629              :     /* Here is the case with the soft mask.  Go ahead and create a new
    1630              :        target buffer (nos) with the same color information etc, but blank
    1631              :        and go ahead and do the blend with the softmask so that it gets applied. */
    1632            0 :     if (nos == NULL && maskbuf != NULL) {
    1633            0 :         nos = pdf14_buf_new(&(tos->rect), ctx->has_tags, !tos->isolated, tos->has_shape,
    1634              :             tos->idle, tos->n_chan, tos->num_spots, ctx->memory, ctx->deep);
    1635            0 :         if (nos == NULL) {
    1636            0 :             code = gs_error_VMerror;
    1637            0 :             goto exit;
    1638              :         }
    1639              : 
    1640            0 :         if_debug4m('v', ctx->memory,
    1641              :             "[v] special buffer for softmask application: %d x %d, %d color channels, %d planes\n",
    1642              :             nos->rect.q.x, nos->rect.q.y, nos->n_chan, nos->n_planes);
    1643              : 
    1644            0 :         nos->dirty = tos->dirty;
    1645            0 :         nos->isolated = tos->isolated;
    1646            0 :         nos->knockout = tos->knockout;
    1647            0 :         nos->alpha = 65535;
    1648            0 :         nos->shape = 65535;
    1649            0 :         nos->opacity = 65535;
    1650            0 :         nos->blend_mode = tos->blend_mode;
    1651            0 :         nos->mask_id = tos->mask_id;
    1652            0 :         nos->group_color_info = pdf14_clone_group_color_info(dev, tos->group_color_info);
    1653              : 
    1654            0 :         if (nos->data != NULL)
    1655            0 :             memset(nos->data, 0,
    1656            0 :                    nos->planestride * (nos->n_chan +
    1657            0 :                                        (nos->has_shape ? 1 : 0) +
    1658            0 :                                        (nos->has_alpha_g ? 1 : 0)));
    1659              :     }
    1660              : 
    1661              :     /* Before we get started, lets see if we have somehow gotten into
    1662              :        what should be an impossible situation where the group color
    1663              :        information does not match the buffer color information. This
    1664              :        can occur is there were memory issues that have perhaps blown
    1665              :        away information, or in the example of Bug 705197 the PDF interpreter
    1666              :        reuses a pattern during a circular reference causing an aliasing
    1667              :        of two nested patterns, one of which has a softmask. The change in
    1668              :        the buffer size of the inner one blows away the buffer of the
    1669              :        outer one leading to a mismatch of color spaces. Here
    1670              :        we can at least catch the case when the color space sizes have
    1671              :        changed and avoid buffer over-runs that would occur when we try
    1672              :        to do the group composition */
    1673            0 :     if (nos->n_chan - 1 != nos->group_color_info->num_components ||
    1674            0 :         tos->n_chan - 1 != tos_num_color_comp)
    1675              :         return_error(gs_error_Fatal);
    1676              : 
    1677            0 :     nos_num_color_comp = nos->group_color_info->num_components - tos->num_spots;
    1678            0 :     tos_num_color_comp = tos_num_color_comp - tos->num_spots;
    1679              : 
    1680              :     /* Sanitise the dirty rectangles, in case some of the drawing routines
    1681              :      * have made them overly large. */
    1682            0 :     rect_intersect(tos->dirty, tos->rect);
    1683            0 :     rect_intersect(nos->dirty, nos->rect);
    1684              :     /* dirty = the marked bbox. rect = the entire bounds of the buffer. */
    1685              :     /* Everything marked on tos that fits onto nos needs to be merged down. */
    1686            0 :     y0 = max(tos->dirty.p.y, nos->rect.p.y);
    1687            0 :     y1 = min(tos->dirty.q.y, nos->rect.q.y);
    1688            0 :     x0 = max(tos->dirty.p.x, nos->rect.p.x);
    1689            0 :     x1 = min(tos->dirty.q.x, nos->rect.q.x);
    1690            0 :     if (ctx->mask_stack) {
    1691              :         /* This can occur when we have a situation where we are ending out of
    1692              :            a group that has internal to it a soft mask and another group.
    1693              :            The soft mask left over from the previous trans group pop is put
    1694              :            into ctx->masbuf, since it is still active if another trans group
    1695              :            push occurs to use it.  If one does not occur, but instead we find
    1696              :            ourselves popping from a parent group, then this softmask is no
    1697              :            longer needed.  We will rc_decrement and set it to NULL. */
    1698            0 :         rc_decrement(ctx->mask_stack->rc_mask, "pdf14_pop_transparency_group");
    1699            0 :         if (ctx->mask_stack->rc_mask == NULL ){
    1700            0 :             gs_free_object(ctx->memory, ctx->mask_stack, "pdf14_pop_transparency_group");
    1701              :         }
    1702            0 :         ctx->mask_stack = NULL;
    1703              :     }
    1704            0 :     ctx->mask_stack = mask_stack;  /* Restore the mask saved by pdf14_push_transparency_group. */
    1705            0 :     tos->mask_stack = NULL;        /* Clean the pointer sinse the mask ownership is now passed to ctx. */
    1706            0 :     if (tos->idle)
    1707            0 :         goto exit;
    1708            0 :     if (maskbuf != NULL && maskbuf->data == NULL && maskbuf->alpha == 255)
    1709            0 :         goto exit;
    1710              : 
    1711              : #if RAW_DUMP
    1712              :     /* Dump the current buffer to see what we have. */
    1713              :     dump_raw_buffer(ctx->memory,
    1714              :                     ctx->stack->rect.q.y-ctx->stack->rect.p.y,
    1715              :                     ctx->stack->rowstride>>ctx->stack->deep, ctx->stack->n_planes,
    1716              :                     ctx->stack->planestride, ctx->stack->rowstride,
    1717              :                     "aaTrans_Group_Pop", ctx->stack->data, ctx->stack->deep);
    1718              :     global_index++;
    1719              : #endif
    1720              : /* Note currently if a pattern space has transparency, the ICC profile is not used
    1721              :    for blending purposes.  Instead we rely upon the gray, rgb, or cmyk parent space.
    1722              :    This is partially due to the fact that pdf14_pop_transparency_group and
    1723              :    pdf14_push_transparnecy_group have no real ICC interaction and those are the
    1724              :    operations called in the tile transparency code.  Instead we may want to
    1725              :    look at pdf14_begin_transparency_group and pdf14_end_transparency group which
    1726              :    is where all the ICC information is handled.  We will return to look at that later */
    1727            0 :     if (nos->group_color_info->icc_profile != NULL) {
    1728            0 :         no_icc_match = !gsicc_profiles_equal(nos->group_color_info->icc_profile, curr_icc_profile);
    1729              :     } else {
    1730              :         /* Let the other tests make the decision if we need to transform */
    1731              :         no_icc_match = false;
    1732              :     }
    1733              :     /* If the color spaces are different and we actually did do a swap of
    1734              :        the procs for color */

    1737            0 :         if (x0 < x1 && y0 < y1) {
    1738            0 :             pdf14_buf *result;
    1739            0 :             bool did_alloc; /* We don't care here */
    1740              : 
    1741            0 :             if (has_matte) {

    1743              :                     tos, tos->data, curr_icc_profile, nos->group_color_info->icc_profile,

    1745            0 :                     tos->rect.q.y - tos->rect.p.y, &did_alloc, tos->deep, false);
    1746            0 :                 has_matte = false;
    1747              :             } else {
    1748            0 :                 result = pdf14_transform_color_buffer_no_matte(pgs, ctx, dev,
    1749              :                     tos, tos->data, curr_icc_profile, nos->group_color_info->icc_profile,

    1752              :             }
    1753            0 :             if (result == NULL) {
    1754              :                 /* Clean up and return error code */
    1755            0 :                 code = gs_error_unknownerror;
    1756            0 :                 goto exit;
    1757              :             }
    1758              : 
    1759              : #if RAW_DUMP
    1760              :             /* Dump the current buffer to see what we have. */

    1762              :                             ctx->stack->rect.q.y-ctx->stack->rect.p.y,

    1773              :         }
    1774              :     } else {
    1775              :         /* Group color spaces are the same.  No color conversions needed */
    1776            0 :         if (x0 < x1 && y0 < y1)

    1779              :                                 drawn_comps, ctx->memory, dev);
    1780              :     }
    1781            0 : exit:
    1782            0 :     ctx->stack = nos;
    1783              :     /* We want to detect the cases where we have luminosity soft masks embedded
    1784              :        within one another.  The "alpha" channel really needs to be merged into
    1785              :        the luminosity channel in this case.  This will occur during the mask pop */

    1788              :            we have softmasks embedded in softmasks */
    1789            0 :         ctx->smask_blend = true;

    1794              :         return_error(code);
    1795              :     return 0;
    1796              : }
    1797              : 
    1798              : /*
    1799              :  * Create a transparency mask that will be used as the mask for
    1800              :  * the next transparency group that is created afterwards.
    1801              :  * The sequence of calls is:
    1802              :  * push_mask, draw the mask, pop_mask, push_group, draw the group, pop_group
    1803              :  */
    1804              : static  int
    1805            0 : pdf14_push_transparency_mask(pdf14_ctx *ctx, gs_int_rect *rect, uint16_t bg_alpha,
    1806              :                              byte *transfer_fn, bool is_ident, bool idle,
    1807              :                              bool replacing, uint mask_id,
    1808              :                              gs_transparency_mask_subtype_t subtype,
    1809              :                              int numcomps, int Background_components,
    1810              :                              const float Background[], int Matte_components,
    1811              :                              const float Matte[], const float GrayBackground,
    1812              :                              pdf14_group_color_t* group_color)
    1813              : {
    1814            0 :     pdf14_buf *buf;
    1815            0 :     int i;
    1816              : 
    1817            0 :     if_debug2m('v', ctx->memory,
    1818              :                "[v]pdf14_push_transparency_mask, idle=%d, replacing=%d\n",
    1819              :                idle, replacing);
    1820            0 :     ctx->smask_depth += 1;
    1821              : 
    1822            0 :     if (ctx->stack == NULL) {
    1823              :         return_error(gs_error_VMerror);
    1824              :     }
    1825              : 
    1826              :     /* An optimization to consider is that if the SubType is Alpha
    1827              :        then we really should only be allocating the alpha band and
    1828              :        only draw with that channel.  Current architecture makes that
    1829              :        a bit tricky.  We need to create this based upon the size of
    1830              :        the color space + an alpha channel. NOT the device size
    1831              :        or the previous ctx size */
    1832              :     /* A mask doesn't worry about tags */
    1833            0 :     buf = pdf14_buf_new(rect, false, false, false, idle, numcomps + 1, 0,
    1834              :                         ctx->memory, ctx->deep);
    1835            0 :     if (buf == NULL)
    1836              :         return_error(gs_error_VMerror);
    1837            0 :     buf->alpha = bg_alpha;
    1838            0 :     buf->is_ident = is_ident;
    1839              :     /* fill in, but these values aren't really used */
    1840            0 :     buf->isolated = true;
    1841            0 :     buf->knockout = false;
    1842            0 :     buf->shape = 0xffff;
    1843            0 :     buf->blend_mode = BLEND_MODE_Normal;
    1844            0 :     buf->transfer_fn = transfer_fn;
    1845            0 :     buf->matte_num_comps = Matte_components;
    1846            0 :     buf->group_color_info = group_color;
    1847              : 
    1848            0 :     if (Matte_components) {
    1849            0 :         buf->matte = (uint16_t *)gs_alloc_bytes(ctx->memory, Matte_components * sizeof(uint16_t) + CAL_SLOP,
    1850              :                                                 "pdf14_push_transparency_mask");
    1851            0 :         if (buf->matte == NULL)
    1852              :             return_error(gs_error_VMerror);
    1853            0 :         for (i = 0; i < Matte_components; i++) {
    1854            0 :             buf->matte[i] = (uint16_t) floor(Matte[i] * 65535.0 + 0.5);
    1855              :         }
    1856              :     }
    1857            0 :     buf->mask_id = mask_id;
    1858              :     /* If replacing=false, we start the mask for an image with SMask.
    1859              :        In this case the image's SMask temporary replaces the
    1860              :        mask of the containing group. Save the containing droup's mask
    1861              :        in buf->mask_stack */
    1862            0 :     buf->mask_stack = ctx->mask_stack;
    1863            0 :     if (buf->mask_stack){
    1864            0 :         rc_increment(buf->mask_stack->rc_mask);
    1865              :     }
    1866              : #if RAW_DUMP
    1867              :     /* Dump the current buffer to see what we have. */
    1868              :     if (ctx->stack->planestride > 0 ){
    1869              :         dump_raw_buffer(ctx->memory,
    1870              :                         ctx->stack->rect.q.y-ctx->stack->rect.p.y,
    1871              :                         ctx->stack->rowstride>>ctx->stack->deep, ctx->stack->n_planes,
    1872              :                         ctx->stack->planestride, ctx->stack->rowstride,
    1873              :                         "Raw_Buf_PreSmask", ctx->stack->data, ctx->stack->deep);
    1874              :         global_index++;
    1875              :     }
    1876              : #endif
    1877            0 :     buf->saved = ctx->stack;
    1878            0 :     ctx->stack = buf;
    1879              :     /* Soft Mask related information so we know how to
    1880              :        compute luminosity when we pop the soft mask */
    1881            0 :     buf->SMask_SubType = subtype;
    1882            0 :     if (buf->data != NULL) {
    1883              :         /* We need to initialize it to the BC if it existed */
    1884              :         /* According to the spec, the CS has to be the same */
    1885              :         /* If the back ground component is black, then don't bother
    1886              :            with this.  Since we are forcing the rendering to gray
    1887              :            earlier now, go ahead and just use the GrayBackGround color
    1888              :            directly. */
    1889            0 :         if ( Background_components && GrayBackground != 0.0 ) {
    1890            0 :             if (buf->deep) {
    1891            0 :                 uint16_t gray = (uint16_t) (65535.0 * GrayBackground);
    1892            0 :                 gs_memset16(buf->data, gray, buf->planestride);
    1893              :                 /* If we have a background component that was not black, then we
    1894              :                    need to set the alpha for this mask as if we had drawn in the
    1895              :                    entire soft mask buffer */
    1896            0 :                 gs_memset16(buf->data + buf->planestride, 65535,
    1897            0 :                             buf->planestride *(buf->n_chan - 1));
    1898              :             } else {
    1899            0 :                 unsigned char gray = (unsigned char) (255.0 * GrayBackground);
    1900            0 :                 memset(buf->data, gray, buf->planestride);
    1901              :                 /* If we have a background component that was not black, then we
    1902              :                    need to set the alpha for this mask as if we had drawn in the
    1903              :                    entire soft mask buffer */
    1904            0 :                 memset(buf->data + buf->planestride, 255,
    1905            0 :                        buf->planestride * (buf->n_chan - 1));
    1906              :             }
    1907              :         } else {
    1908              :             /* Compose mask with opaque background */
    1909            0 :             memset(buf->data, 0, buf->planestride * buf->n_chan);
    1910              :         }
    1911              :     }
    1912              :     return 0;
    1913              : }
    1914              : 
    1915            0 : static void pdf14_free_mask_stack(pdf14_ctx *ctx, gs_memory_t *memory)
    1916              : {
    1917            0 :     pdf14_mask_t *mask_stack = ctx->mask_stack;
    1918              : 
    1919            0 :     if (mask_stack->rc_mask != NULL) {
    1920              :         pdf14_mask_t *curr_mask = mask_stack;
    1921              :         pdf14_mask_t *old_mask;
    1922            0 :         while (curr_mask != NULL) {
    1923              :             /* Force to decrement until free */
    1924            0 :             while (curr_mask->rc_mask != NULL)
    1925            0 :                 rc_decrement(curr_mask->rc_mask, "pdf14_free_mask_stack");
    1926            0 :             old_mask = curr_mask;
    1927            0 :             curr_mask = curr_mask->previous;
    1928            0 :             gs_free_object(old_mask->memory, old_mask, "pdf14_free_mask_stack");
    1929              :         }
    1930              :     } else {
    1931            0 :         gs_free_object(memory, mask_stack, "pdf14_free_mask_stack");
    1932              :     }
    1933            0 :     ctx->mask_stack = NULL;
    1934            0 : }
    1935              : 
    1936              : static  int
    1937            0 : pdf14_pop_transparency_mask(pdf14_ctx *ctx, gs_gstate *pgs, gx_device *dev)
    1938              : {
    1939            0 :     pdf14_buf* tos = ctx->stack;
    1940            0 :     pdf14_buf* nos = tos->saved;
    1941            0 :     byte *new_data_buf;
    1942            0 :     int icc_match;
    1943            0 :     cmm_profile_t *des_profile = nos->group_color_info->icc_profile; /* If set, this should be a gray profile */
    1944            0 :     cmm_profile_t *src_profile;
    1945            0 :     gsicc_rendering_param_t rendering_params;
    1946            0 :     gsicc_link_t *icc_link;
    1947            0 :     gsicc_rendering_param_t render_cond;
    1948            0 :     cmm_dev_profile_t *dev_profile;
    1949            0 :     int code = 0;
    1950              : 
    1951            0 :     dev_proc(dev, get_profile)(dev,  &dev_profile);
    1952            0 :     gsicc_extract_profile(GS_UNKNOWN_TAG, dev_profile, &src_profile,
    1953              :                           &render_cond);
    1954            0 :     ctx->smask_depth -= 1;
    1955              :     /* icc_match == -1 means old non-icc code.
    1956              :        icc_match == 0 means use icc code
    1957              :        icc_match == 1 mean no conversion needed */
    1958            0 :     if (des_profile != NULL && src_profile != NULL ) {
    1959            0 :         icc_match = gsicc_profiles_equal(des_profile, src_profile);
    1960              :     } else {
    1961              :         icc_match = -1;
    1962              :     }
    1963            0 :     if_debug1m('v', ctx->memory, "[v]pdf14_pop_transparency_mask, idle=%d\n",
    1964              :                tos->idle);
    1965            0 :     ctx->stack = tos->saved;
    1966            0 :     tos->saved = NULL;  /* To avoid issues with GC */
    1967            0 :     if (tos->mask_stack) {
    1968              :         /* During the soft mask push, the mask_stack was copied (not moved) from
    1969              :            the ctx to the tos mask_stack. We are done with this now so it is safe to
    1970              :            just set to NULL.  However, before we do that we must perform
    1971              :            rc decrement to match the increment that occured was made.  Also,
    1972              :            if this is the last ref count of the rc_mask, we should free the
    1973              :            buffer now since no other groups need it. */
    1974            0 :         rc_decrement(tos->mask_stack->rc_mask,
    1975              :                      "pdf14_pop_transparency_mask(tos->mask_stack->rc_mask)");
    1976            0 :         if (tos->mask_stack->rc_mask) {
    1977            0 :             if (tos->mask_stack->rc_mask->rc.ref_count == 1){
    1978            0 :                 rc_decrement(tos->mask_stack->rc_mask,
    1979              :                             "pdf14_pop_transparency_mask(tos->mask_stack->rc_mask)");
    1980              :             }
    1981              :         }
    1982            0 :         tos->mask_stack = NULL;
    1983              :     }
    1984            0 :     if (tos->data == NULL ) {
    1985              :         /* This can occur in clist rendering if the soft mask does
    1986              :            not intersect the current band.  It would be nice to
    1987              :            catch this earlier and just avoid creating the structure
    1988              :            to begin with.  For now we need to delete the structure
    1989              :            that was created.  Only delete if the alpha value is 65535 */
    1990            0 :         if ((tos->alpha == 65535 && tos->is_ident) ||
    1991            0 :             (!tos->is_ident && (tos->transfer_fn[tos->alpha>>8] == 255))) {
    1992            0 :             pdf14_buf_free(tos);
    1993            0 :             if (ctx->mask_stack != NULL) {
    1994            0 :                 pdf14_free_mask_stack(ctx, ctx->memory);
    1995              :             }
    1996              :         } else {
    1997              :             /* Assign as mask buffer */
    1998            0 :             if (ctx->mask_stack != NULL) {
    1999            0 :                 pdf14_free_mask_stack(ctx, ctx->memory);
    2000              :             }
    2001            0 :             ctx->mask_stack = pdf14_mask_element_new(ctx->memory);
    2002            0 :             ctx->mask_stack->rc_mask = pdf14_rcmask_new(ctx->memory);
    2003            0 :             ctx->mask_stack->rc_mask->mask_buf = tos;
    2004              :         }
    2005            0 :         ctx->smask_blend = false;  /* just in case */
    2006              :     } else {
    2007              :         /* If we are already in the source space then there is no reason
    2008              :            to do the transformation */
    2009              :         /* Lets get this to a monochrome buffer and map it to a luminance only value */
    2010              :         /* This will reduce our memory.  We won't reuse the existing one, due */
    2011              :         /* Due to the fact that on certain systems we may have issues recovering */
    2012              :         /* the data after a resize */
    2013            0 :         new_data_buf = gs_alloc_bytes(ctx->memory, tos->planestride + CAL_SLOP,
    2014              :                                         "pdf14_pop_transparency_mask");
    2015            0 :         if (new_data_buf == NULL)
    2016              :             return_error(gs_error_VMerror);
    2017              :         /* Initialize with 0.  Need to do this since in Smask_Luminosity_Mapping
    2018              :            we won't be filling everything during the remap if it had not been
    2019              :            written into by the PDF14 fill rect */
    2020            0 :         memset(new_data_buf, 0, tos->planestride);
    2021              :         /* If the subtype was alpha, then just grab the alpha channel now
    2022              :            and we are all done */
    2023            0 :         if (tos->SMask_SubType == TRANSPARENCY_MASK_Alpha) {
    2024            0 :             ctx->smask_blend = false;  /* not used in this case */
    2025            0 :             smask_copy(tos->rect.q.y - tos->rect.p.y,
    2026            0 :                        (tos->rect.q.x - tos->rect.p.x)<<tos->deep,
    2027              :                        tos->rowstride,
    2028            0 :                        (tos->data)+tos->planestride, new_data_buf);
    2029              : #if RAW_DUMP
    2030              :             /* Dump the current buffer to see what we have. */
    2031              :             dump_raw_buffer(ctx->memory,
    2032              :                             tos->rect.q.y-tos->rect.p.y,

    2034              :                             tos->planestride, tos->rowstride,
    2035              :                             "SMask_Pop_Alpha(Mask_Plane1)",tos->data,
    2036              :                             tos->deep);
    2037              :             global_index++;
    2038              : #endif
    2039              :         } else {
    2040            0 :             if (icc_match == 1 || tos->n_chan == 2) {
    2041              : #if RAW_DUMP
    2042              :                 /* Dump the current buffer to see what we have. */
    2043              :                 dump_raw_buffer(ctx->memory,
    2044              :                                 tos->rect.q.y-tos->rect.p.y,
    2045              :                                 tos->rowstride>>tos->deep, tos->n_planes,
    2046              :                                 tos->planestride, tos->rowstride,
    2047              :                                 "SMask_Pop_Lum(Mask_Plane0)",tos->data,
    2048              :                                 tos->deep);
    2049              :                 global_index++;
    2050              : #endif
    2051              :                 /* There is no need to color convert.  Data is already gray scale.
    2052              :                    We just need to copy the gray plane.  However it is
    2053              :                    possible that the soft mask could have a soft mask which
    2054              :                    would end us up with some alpha blending information
    2055              :                    (Bug691803). In fact, according to the spec, the alpha
    2056              :                    blending has to occur.  See FTS test fts_26_2601.pdf
    2057              :                    for an example of this.  Softmask buffer is intialized
    2058              :                    with BG values.  It would be nice to keep track if buffer
    2059              :                    ever has a alpha value not 1 so that we could detect and
    2060              :                    avoid this blend if not needed. */
    2061            0 :                 smask_blend(tos->data, tos->rect.q.x - tos->rect.p.x,
    2062            0 :                             tos->rect.q.y - tos->rect.p.y, tos->rowstride,
    2063              :                             tos->planestride, tos->deep);
    2064              : #if RAW_DUMP
    2065              :                 /* Dump the current buffer to see what we have. */
    2066              :                 dump_raw_buffer(ctx->memory,
    2067              :                                 tos->rect.q.y-tos->rect.p.y,
    2068              :                                 tos->rowstride>>tos->deep, 1,
    2069              :                                 tos->planestride, tos->rowstride,
    2070              :                                 "SMask_Pop_Lum_Post_Blend",tos->data,
    2071              :                                 tos->deep);
    2072              :                 global_index++;
    2073              : #endif
    2074            0 :                 smask_copy(tos->rect.q.y - tos->rect.p.y,
    2075            0 :                            (tos->rect.q.x - tos->rect.p.x)<<tos->deep,
    2076              :                            tos->rowstride, tos->data, new_data_buf);
    2077              :             } else {
    2078            0 :                 if ( icc_match == -1 ) {
    2079              :                     /* The slow old fashioned way */
    2080            0 :                     smask_luminosity_mapping(tos->rect.q.y - tos->rect.p.y ,
    2081            0 :                         tos->rect.q.x - tos->rect.p.x,tos->n_chan,
    2082              :                         tos->rowstride, tos->planestride,
    2083            0 :                         tos->data,  new_data_buf, ctx->additive, tos->SMask_SubType,
    2084              :                         tos->deep
    2085              : #if RAW_DUMP
    2086              :                         , ctx->memory
    2087              : #endif
    2088              :                         );
    2089              :                 } else {
    2090              :                     /* ICC case where we use the CMM */
    2091              :                     /* Request the ICC link for the transform that we will need to use */
    2092            0 :                     rendering_params.black_point_comp = gsBLACKPTCOMP_OFF;
    2093            0 :                     rendering_params.graphics_type_tag = GS_IMAGE_TAG;
    2094            0 :                     rendering_params.override_icc = false;
    2095            0 :                     rendering_params.preserve_black = gsBKPRESNOTSPECIFIED;
    2096            0 :                     rendering_params.rendering_intent = gsRELATIVECOLORIMETRIC;

    2288              : /* Used to pass along information about the buffer created by the

    2466              :     /* If we are doing a 16 bit buffer it will be big endian if we have already done the

    2468              :        but for sanity pdf14 device maintains 16bit buffers in native format.  The CMM
    2469              :        will need to know if it is dealing with native or BE data. */
    2470            0 :     if (was_blended && (*buf)->deep) {

    2475              : #else
    2476              :         endian_swap = true;
    2477              : #endif
    2478              :     } else {
    2479              :         /* Data is in native format. No swap needed for CMM */
    2480            0 :         endian_swap = false;
    2481              :     }

    2505              : 
    2506              : /**
    2507              :  * pdf14_put_image: Put rendered image to target device.
    2508              :  * @pdev: The PDF 1.4 rendering device.
    2509              :  * @pgs: State for image draw operation.
    2510              :  * @target: The target device.
    2511              :  *
    2512              :  * Puts the rendered image in @pdev's buffer to @target. This is called
    2513              :  * as part of the sequence of popping the PDF 1.4 device filter.
    2514              :  *
    2515              :  * Return code: negative on error.
    2516              :  **/
    2517              : static  int
    2518            0 : pdf14_put_image(gx_device * dev, gs_gstate * pgs, gx_device * target)
    2519              : {
    2520            0 :     const pdf14_device * pdev = (pdf14_device *)dev;
    2521            0 :     int code;

    2525            0 :     gs_int_rect rect;
    2526            0 :     int y;
    2527            0 :     int num_comp;
    2528            0 :     byte *linebuf, *linebuf_unaligned;

    2530            0 :     int x1, y1, width, height;
    2531            0 :     byte *buf_ptr;
    2532            0 :     int num_rows_left;

    2828              : /* Overprint simulation with spots.  Collapse to CMYK */

    2830            0 : template_spots_to_cmyk(byte *buf_ptr, int width, int height, intptr_t rowstride,
    2831              :     intptr_t planestride, int num_comp, int spot_start, int tag_offset,
    2832              :     cmyk_composite_map *map, bool keep_alpha)

    2856            0 :                     black += cmyk_map_entry->k * comp;

    2898              : static void
    2899            0 : template_spots_to_cmyk_16(byte *buf_ptr_, int width, int height, intptr_t rowstride,
    2900              :     intptr_t planestride, int num_comp, int spot_start, int tag_offset,
    2901              :     cmyk_composite_map *map, bool keep_alpha)
    2902              : {
    2903            0 :     int comp_num;

    2908            0 :     ulong comp, a;
    2909            0 :     uint16_t *buf_ptr = (uint16_t *)(void *)buf_ptr_;
    2910              : 
    2911              :     /* planestride and rowstride are in bytes, and we want them in shorts */
    2912            0 :     planestride >>= 1;
    2913            0 :     rowstride >>= 1;
    2914              : 
    2915            0 :     for (y = 0; y < height; y++) {

    2925            0 :                 for (comp_num = spot_start; comp_num < num_comp; comp_num++) {
    2926            0 :                     comp = buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num];
    2927            0 :                     cyan += (ulong)cmyk_map_entry->c * comp;
    2928            0 :                     magenta += (ulong)cmyk_map_entry->m * comp;
    2929            0 :                     yellow += (ulong)cmyk_map_entry->y * comp;
    2930            0 :                     black += (ulong)cmyk_map_entry->k * comp;
    2931            0 :                     cmyk_map_entry++;
    2932              :                 }

    2945            0 :                     black = 65535;

    2949              :                 buf_ptr[position + planestride] = magenta;
    2950              :                 buf_ptr[position + planestride * 2] = yellow;
    2951              :                 buf_ptr[position + planestride * 3] = black;
    2952              : #else
    2953            0 :                 ((byte *)&buf_ptr[position])[0] = cyan >> 8;
    2954            0 :                 ((byte *)&buf_ptr[position])[1] = cyan;
    2955            0 :                 ((byte *)&buf_ptr[position + planestride])[0] = magenta >> 8;
    2956            0 :                 ((byte *)&buf_ptr[position + planestride])[1] = magenta;

    2960            0 :                 ((byte *)&buf_ptr[position + planestride * 3])[1] = black;
    2961              : #endif
    2962              :             }
    2963              :             /* Move the alpha and tag data */
    2964              : #if ARCH_IS_BIG_ENDIAN
    2965              :             if (keep_alpha) {
    2966              :                 buf_ptr[position + planestride * 4] = a;

    2968              :                     buf_ptr[position + planestride * 5] =
    2969              :                         buf_ptr[position + planestride * tag_offset];
    2970              :                 }

    2973              :                     buf_ptr[position + planestride * 4] =
    2974              :                         buf_ptr[position + planestride * tag_offset];

    2976              :             }

    3053              : /* This is for the case where we have mixture of spots and additive color.

    3055              : static void
    3056            0 : pdf14_blend_image_mixed_buffer(byte* buf_ptr, int width, int height, intptr_t rowstride,
    3057              :     intptr_t planestride, int num_comp, int spot_start)
    3058              : {
    3059            0 :     int x, y;
    3060            0 :     intptr_t position;
    3061            0 :     byte comp, a;
    3062            0 :     int tmp, comp_num;
    3063              : 
    3064            0 :     for (y = 0; y < height; y++) {
    3065            0 :         position = y * rowstride;
    3066            0 :         for (x = 0; x < width; x++) {
    3067            0 :             a = buf_ptr[position + planestride * num_comp];
    3068            0 :             if ((a + 1) & 0xfe) {
    3069            0 :                 a ^= 0xff;
    3070            0 :                 for (comp_num = 0; comp_num < spot_start; comp_num++) {
    3071            0 :                     comp = buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num];
    3072            0 :                     tmp = ((0xff - comp) * a) + 0x80;
    3073            0 :                     comp += (tmp + (tmp >> 8)) >> 8;
    3074            0 :                     buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num] = comp;
    3075              :                 }
    3076            0 :                 for (comp_num = spot_start; comp_num < num_comp; comp_num++) {
    3077            0 :                     comp = buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num];
    3078            0 :                     tmp = ((-comp) * a) + 0x80;
    3079            0 :                     comp += (tmp + (tmp >> 8)) >> 8;
    3080            0 :                     buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num] = comp;
    3081              :                 }
    3082            0 :             } else if (a == 0) {
    3083            0 :                 for (comp_num = 0; comp_num < spot_start; comp_num++) {
    3084            0 :                     buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num] = 0xff;
    3085              :                 }
    3086            0 :                 for (comp_num = spot_start; comp_num < num_comp; comp_num++) {
    3087            0 :                     buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num] = 0;
    3088              :                 }
    3089              :             }
    3090            0 :             position += 1;
    3091              :         }
    3092              :     }
    3093            0 : }
    3094              : 
    3095              : static void
    3096            0 : pdf14_blend_image_mixed_buffer16(byte* buf_ptr_, int width, int height, intptr_t rowstride,
    3097              :     intptr_t planestride, int num_comp, int spot_start)
    3098              : {
    3099            0 :     uint16_t* buf_ptr = (uint16_t*)(void*)buf_ptr_;
    3100            0 :     int x, y;
    3101            0 :     intptr_t position;
    3102            0 :     int comp, a;
    3103            0 :     int tmp, comp_num;
    3104              : 
    3105              :     /* planestride and rowstride are in bytes, and we want them in shorts */
    3106            0 :     planestride >>= 1;
    3107            0 :     rowstride >>= 1;
    3108              : 
    3109              :     /* Note that the input here is native endian, and the output must be in big endian! */
    3110            0 :     for (y = 0; y < height; y++) {
    3111            0 :         position = y * rowstride;
    3112            0 :         for (x = 0; x < width; x++) {
    3113              :             /* composite RGBA (or CMYKA, etc.) pixel with over solid background */
    3114            0 :             a = buf_ptr[position + planestride * num_comp];
    3115            0 :             if (a == 0) {
    3116            0 :                 for (comp_num = 0; comp_num < spot_start; comp_num++) {
    3117            0 :                     buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num] = 0xffff;
    3118              :                 }
    3119            0 :                 for (comp_num = spot_start; comp_num < num_comp; comp_num++) {
    3120            0 :                     buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num] = 0;
    3121              :                 }
    3122            0 :             } else if (a == 0xffff) {
    3123              : #if ARCH_IS_BIG_ENDIAN
    3124              : #else
    3125              :                 /* Convert from native -> big endian */
    3126            0 :                 for (comp_num = 0; comp_num < num_comp; comp_num++) {
    3127            0 :                     comp = buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num];
    3128            0 :                     ((byte*)&buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num])[0] = comp >> 8;
    3129            0 :                     ((byte*)&buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num])[1] = comp;
    3130              :                 }
    3131              : #endif
    3132              :             } else {
    3133            0 :                 a ^= 0xffff;
    3134            0 :                 a += a >> 15; /* a is now 0 to 0x10000 */
    3135            0 :                 a >>= 1; /* We can only use 15 bits as bg-comp has a sign bit we can't lose */
    3136            0 :                 for (comp_num = 0; comp_num < spot_start; comp_num++) {
    3137            0 :                     comp = buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num];
    3138            0 :                     tmp = ((0xffff - comp) * a) + 0x4000;
    3139            0 :                     comp += (tmp >> 15); /* Errors in bit 16 upwards will be ignored */
    3140              :                     /* Store as big endian */
    3141            0 :                     ((byte*)&buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num])[0] = comp >> 8;
    3142            0 :                     ((byte*)&buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num])[1] = comp;
    3143              :                 }
    3144            0 :                 for (comp_num = spot_start; comp_num < num_comp; comp_num++) {
    3145            0 :                     comp = buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num];
    3146            0 :                     tmp = ((0 - comp) * a) + 0x4000;
    3147            0 :                     comp += (tmp >> 15); /* Errors in bit 16 upwards will be ignored */
    3148              :                     /* Store as big endian */
    3149            0 :                     ((byte*)&buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num])[0] = comp >> 8;
    3150            0 :                     ((byte*)&buf_ptr[position + planestride * comp_num])[1] = comp;
    3151              :                 }
    3152              :             }
    3153            0 :             position += 1;
    3154              :         }
    3155              :     }
    3156            0 : }

    3370            0 :                 for (i = 0; i < width; i++)

    3374            0 :                     ((byte *)tags)[-1] = tag;

    3388              :            we have spot colors, then bring the spot color channels into CMYK

    3391              :            here that 16 bit data will be converted to BE. Otherwise it will have been converted
    3392              :            above during the alpha blend operation. */

    3608              : /**
    3609              :  * pdf14_cmykspot_put_image: Put rendered image to target device.
    3610              :  * @pdev: The PDF 1.4 rendering device.
    3611              :  * @pgs: State for image draw operation.
    3612              :  * @target: The target device.
    3613              :  *
    3614              :  * Puts the rendered image in @pdev's buffer to @target. This is called
    3615              :  * as part of the sequence of popping the PDF 1.4 device filter.
    3616              :  *
    3617              :  * Return code: negative on error.
    3618              :  **/
    3619              : static  int
    3620            0 : pdf14_cmykspot_put_image(gx_device *dev, gs_gstate *pgs, gx_device *target)
    3621              : {
    3622            0 :     pdf14_device *pdev = (pdf14_device *)dev;
    3623            0 :     pdf14_buf *buf = pdev->ctx->stack;
    3624            0 :     gs_int_rect rect;
    3625            0 :     int x1, y1, width, height;
    3626            0 :     gs_devn_params *pdevn_params = &pdev->devn_params;
    3627            0 :     gs_separations *pseparations = &pdevn_params->separations;
    3628            0 :     intptr_t planestride;
    3629            0 :     intptr_t rowstride;
    3630            0 :     bool deep = pdev->ctx->deep;
    3631            0 :     int num_comp;
    3632              : 
    3633              :     /* Nothing was ever drawn. */
    3634            0 :     if (buf == NULL)
    3635              :         return 0;
    3636              : 
    3637            0 :     num_comp = buf->n_chan - 1;
    3638            0 :     rect = buf->rect;
    3639            0 :     planestride = buf->planestride;

    3642              :     /* Make sure that this is the only item on the stack. Fuzzing revealed a
    3643              :        potential problem. Bug 694190 */

    3645            0 :         return gs_throw(gs_error_unknownerror, "PDF14 device push/pop out of sync");
    3646              :     }

    3648            0 :     rect_intersect(rect, buf->dirty);
    3649            0 :     x1 = min(pdev->width, rect.q.x);
    3650            0 :     y1 = min(pdev->height, rect.q.y);
    3651            0 :     width = x1 - rect.p.x;
    3652            0 :     height = y1 - rect.p.y;

    3654              :         return 0;

    3676              : /**

    3687              : static  int
    3688            0 : pdf14_custom_put_image(gx_device * dev, gs_gstate * pgs, gx_device * target)

    3729            0 :     return gx_put_blended_image_custom(target, buf_ptr,
    3730              :                       planestride, rowstride,

    3732              : }
    3733              : 
    3734              : /* This is rather nasty: in the event we are interrupted (by an error) between a push and pop
    3735              :  * of one or more groups, we have to cycle through any ICC profile changes since the push
    3736              :  * putting everything back how it was, and cleaning up the reference counts.
    3737              :  */
    3738            0 : static void pdf14_cleanup_group_color_profiles (pdf14_device *pdev)
    3739              : {
    3740            0 :     if (pdev->ctx && pdev->ctx->stack) {
    3741            0 :         pdf14_buf *buf, *next;
    3742              : 
    3743            0 :         for (buf = pdev->ctx->stack->saved; buf != NULL; buf = next) {
    3744            0 :             pdf14_group_color_t *group_color_info = buf->group_color_info;
    3745            0 :             next = buf->saved;
    3746            0 :             while (group_color_info) {
    3747            0 :                if (group_color_info->icc_profile != NULL) {
    3748            0 :                    cmm_profile_t *group_profile;
    3749            0 :                    gsicc_rendering_param_t render_cond;
    3750            0 :                    cmm_dev_profile_t *dev_profile;
    3751            0 :                    int code = dev_proc((gx_device *)pdev, get_profile)((gx_device *)pdev,  &dev_profile);
    3752              : 
    3753            0 :                    if (code >= 0) {
    3754            0 :                        gsicc_extract_profile(GS_UNKNOWN_TAG, dev_profile, &group_profile,
    3755              :                                              &render_cond);
    3756              : 
    3757            0 :                        gsicc_adjust_profile_rc(pdev->icc_struct->device_profile[GS_DEFAULT_DEVICE_PROFILE],
    3758              :                                                -1, "pdf14_end_transparency_group");
    3759            0 :                        pdev->icc_struct->device_profile[GS_DEFAULT_DEVICE_PROFILE] =
    3760            0 :                            group_color_info->icc_profile;
    3761            0 :                        group_color_info->icc_profile = NULL;
    3762              :                    }
    3763              :                }
    3764              : 
    3765            0 :                group_color_info = group_color_info->previous;
    3766              :             }
    3767              :         }
    3768              :     }
    3769            0 : }
    3770              : 
    3771              : static  int
    3772            0 : pdf14_close(gx_device *dev)
    3773              : {
    3774            0 :     pdf14_device *pdev = (pdf14_device *)dev;
    3775              : 
    3776            0 :     pdf14_cleanup_group_color_profiles(pdev);
    3777              : 
    3778            0 :     if (pdev->ctx) {
    3779            0 :         pdf14_ctx_free(pdev->ctx);
    3780            0 :         pdev->ctx = NULL;
    3781              :     }
    3782            0 :     return 0;
    3783              : }
    3784              : 
    3785              : /* This is called when something has gone wrong and the interpreter received a
    3786              :    stop while in the middle of doing something with the PDF14 device.  We need

    4575              : /* Cleanup after the stroke in fill-stroke  */
    4576              : static int
    4577            0 : pdf14_fill_stroke_poststroke(gx_device* dev, gs_gstate* pgs, float fill_alpha, bool op_ca_eq_CA)

    4579            0 :     int code;
    4580              : 
    4581            0 :     if (!op_ca_eq_CA) {
    4582              :         /* Bug 703324 we need to reset the fill constant alpha in the graphics
    4583              :           * state to the correct saved value. We also need to reset the 'opacity' member of the
    4584              :           * device, because some device methods (eg fill_masked_image) don't take a graphics
    4585              :           * state pointer as a parameter and so are unable to set the opacity value themselves.
    4586              :           * We therefore need to make sure it is set according to the current fill state.
    4587              :           */
    4588            0 :         (void)gs_setfillconstantalpha(pgs, fill_alpha);
    4589            0 :         code = gs_update_trans_marking_params(pgs);
    4590            0 :         if (code < 0)
    4591              :             return code;
    4592            0 :         pdf14_set_marking_params(dev, pgs);
    4593              :     }
    4594              : 
    4595              :     return 0;
    4596              : }
    4597              : 
    4598              : /* cleanup in fill-stroke  */
    4599              : static int
    4600            0 : pdf14_fill_stroke_cleanup(gx_device* dev, gs_gstate* pgs, float fill_alpha, float stroke_alpha,
    4601              :     gs_blend_mode_t blend_mode, PDF14_OP_FS_STATE save_op_state)
    4602              : {
    4603            0 :     pdf14_device* p14dev = (pdf14_device*)dev;
    4604            0 :     int code2;
    4605            0 :     int code = 0;
    4606              : 
    4607              :     /* Restore the state */
    4608            0 :     p14dev->op_state = save_op_state;
    4609            0 :     (void)gs_setblendmode(pgs, blend_mode); /* Can never fail */
    4610            0 :     (void)gs_setstrokeconstantalpha(pgs, stroke_alpha);
    4611            0 :     (void)gs_setfillconstantalpha(pgs, fill_alpha);
    4612              : 
    4613            0 :     code2 = gs_end_transparency_group(pgs);
    4614            0 :     if (code2 < 0) {
    4615              :         /* At this point things have gone very wrong. We should just shut down */
    4616            0 :         code = gs_abort_pdf14trans_device(pgs);
    4617            0 :         return code2;
    4618              :     }
    4619              :     return code;

    4622              : static int

    4747              : static int
    4748            0 : do_pdf14_copy_alpha_color(gx_device * dev, const byte * data, int data_x,

    4751              :                           const gx_device_color *pdc, int depth, bool devn)

    4766            0 :     bool has_shape = buf->has_shape;

    4788            0 :     bool has_backdrop = buf->backdrop != NULL;
    4789              : 
    4790            0 :     if (buf->data == NULL)
    4791              :         return 0;
    4792            0 :     aa_row = data;

    4794            0 :         if (devn)
    4795            0 :             curr_tag = pdc->tag;
    4796              :         else
    4797            0 :             curr_tag = (color >> (num_comp*8)) & 0xff;

    4818            0 :         w += x - buf->rect.p.x;
    4819            0 :         x = buf->rect.p.x;

    4821              :         xoff = data_x;
    4822              :     }

    4826            0 :       y = buf->rect.p.y;

    4853            0 :                 for (k = 0; k < num_comp; ++k)

    4855            0 :                 dst[num_comp] = back_ptr[num_comp * planestride];       /* alpha */

    4859              :             {

    4868            0 :                 alpha_aa = aa_row[sx];

    4888              :                 }
    4889            0 :                 if (knockout) {

    4915            0 :                         for (k = 0; k < num_comp; ++k)
    4916            0 :                             dst_ptr[k * planestride] = 255 - dst[k];

    4932            0 :                     if (src[num_comp] == 255 && tag_blend) {
    4933            0 :                         dst_ptr[tag_off] = curr_tag;
    4934              :                     } else {
    4935            0 :                         dst_ptr[tag_off] = back_ptr[tag_off] | curr_tag;
    4936              :                     }
    4937              :                 }

    5030              :     /* Update the dirty rectangle. */
    5031            0 :     if (x < buf->dirty.p.x) buf->dirty.p.x = x;
    5032            0 :     if (y < buf->dirty.p.y) buf->dirty.p.y = y;

    5042              : 
    5043            0 :     planestride >>= 1;
    5044            0 :     rowstride   >>= 1;

    5293              : 
    5294              : /* Used for filling rects when we are doing a fill with a pattern that
