    5296              : static  int
    5297            0 : pdf14_tile_pattern_fill(gx_device * pdev, const gs_gstate * pgs,
    5298              :                         gx_path * ppath, const gx_fill_params * params,
    5299              :                         const gx_device_color * pdevc,
    5300              :                         const gx_clip_path * pcpath)
    5301              : {
    5302            0 :     int code;
    5303            0 :     gs_gstate *pgs_noconst = (gs_gstate *)pgs; /* Break const. */
    5304            0 :     gs_fixed_rect clip_box;
    5305            0 :     gs_fixed_rect outer_box;
    5306            0 :     pdf14_device * p14dev = (pdf14_device *)pdev;
    5307            0 :     gs_int_rect rect;
    5308            0 :     gx_clip_rect *curr_clip_rect;
    5309            0 :     gx_color_tile *ptile = NULL;
    5310            0 :     int k;
    5311            0 :     gx_pattern_trans_t *fill_trans_buffer = NULL;
    5312            0 :     gs_int_point phase;  /* Needed during clist rendering for band offset */
    5313            0 :     int n_chan_tile;
    5314            0 :     gx_clip_path cpath_intersection;
    5315            0 :     gx_path path_ttrans;
    5316            0 :     pdf14_group_color_t *group_color_info;
    5317            0 :     bool has_tags = device_encodes_tags(pdev);
    5318              : 
    5319            0 :     if (ppath == NULL)
    5320              :         return_error(gs_error_unknownerror);    /* should not happen */
    5321            0 :     if (pcpath != NULL) {
    5322            0 :         code = gx_cpath_init_local_shared_nested(&cpath_intersection, pcpath, ppath->memory, 1);
    5323              :     } else {
    5324            0 :         (*dev_proc(pdev, get_clipping_box)) (pdev, &clip_box);
    5325            0 :         gx_cpath_init_local(&cpath_intersection, ppath->memory);
    5326            0 :         code = gx_cpath_from_rectangle(&cpath_intersection, &clip_box);
    5327              :     }
    5328            0 :     if (code < 0)
    5329              :         return code;
    5330            0 :     code = gx_cpath_intersect_with_params(&cpath_intersection, ppath,
    5331            0 :                                           params->rule, pgs_noconst, params);
    5332            0 :     if (code < 0)
    5333              :         return code;
    5334              :     /* One (common) case worth optimising for is where we have a pattern that
    5335              :      * is positioned such that only one repeat of the tile is actually
    5336              :      * visible. In this case, we can restrict the size of the blending group
    5337              :      * we need to produce to be that of the actual area of the tile that is
    5338              :      * used. */
    5339            0 :     ptile = pdevc->colors.pattern.p_tile;
    5340            0 :     if (ptile->ttrans != NULL)
    5341              :     {
    5342            0 :         if ((cpath_intersection.outer_box.p.x < 0) ||
    5343            0 :             (cpath_intersection.outer_box.p.y < 0) ||
    5344            0 :             (cpath_intersection.outer_box.q.x > int2fixed(ptile->ttrans->width)) ||
    5345            0 :             (cpath_intersection.outer_box.q.y > int2fixed(ptile->ttrans->height)))
    5346              :         {
    5347              :             /* More than one repeat of the tile would be visible, so we can't
    5348              :              * use the optimisation here. (Actually, this test isn't quite
    5349              :              * right - it actually tests whether more than the '0th' repeat
    5350              :              * of the tile is visible. A better test would test if just one
    5351              :              * repeat of the tile was visible, irrespective of which one.
    5352              :              * This is (hopefully) relatively rare, and would make the code
    5353              :              * below more complex too, so we're ignoring that for now. If it
    5354              :              * becomes evident that it's a case that matters we can revisit
    5355              :              * it.) */
    5356              :         } else {
    5357              :             /* Only the 0th repeat is visible. Restrict the size further to
    5358              :              * just the used area of that patch. */
    5359            0 :             gx_path_init_local(&path_ttrans, ppath->memory);
    5360            0 :             code = gx_path_add_rectangle(&path_ttrans,
    5361            0 :                                          int2fixed(ptile->ttrans->rect.p.x),
    5362            0 :                                          int2fixed(ptile->ttrans->rect.p.y),
    5363            0 :                                          int2fixed(ptile->ttrans->rect.q.x),
    5364            0 :                                          int2fixed(ptile->ttrans->rect.q.y));
    5365            0 :             if (code < 0)
    5366              :                 return code;
    5367            0 :             code = gx_cpath_intersect(&cpath_intersection, &path_ttrans,
    5368            0 :                                       params->rule, pgs_noconst);
    5369            0 :             gx_path_free(&path_ttrans, "pdf14_tile_pattern_fill(path_ttrans)");
    5370            0 :             if (code < 0)
    5371              :                 return code;
    5372              :         }
    5373              :     }
    5374              :     /* Now let us push a transparency group into which we are
    5375              :      * going to tile the pattern.  */
    5376            0 :     if (ppath != NULL) {
    5377            0 :         pdf14_device save_pdf14_dev;            /* save area for p14dev */
    5378              : 
    5379            0 :         gx_cpath_outer_box(&cpath_intersection, &outer_box);
    5380            0 :         rect.p.x = fixed2int(outer_box.p.x);
    5381            0 :         rect.p.y = fixed2int(outer_box.p.y);
    5382            0 :         rect.q.x = fixed2int_ceiling(outer_box.q.x);
    5383            0 :         rect.q.y = fixed2int_ceiling(outer_box.q.y);
    5384              : 
    5385              :         /* The color space of this group must be the same as that of the
    5386              :            tile.  Then when we pop the group, if there is a mismatch between
    5387              :            the tile color space and the current context we will do the proper
    5388              :            conversion.  In this way, we ensure that if the tile has any overlapping
    5389              :            occuring it will be blended in the proper manner i.e in the tile
    5390              :            underlying color space. */
    5391            0 :         if (ptile->cdev == NULL) {
    5392            0 :             if (ptile->ttrans == NULL)
    5393            0 :                 return_error(gs_error_unknownerror);    /* should not happen */
    5394            0 :             n_chan_tile = ptile->ttrans->n_chan;
    5395              :         } else {
    5396            0 :             n_chan_tile = ptile->cdev->common.color_info.num_components+1;
    5397              :         }
    5398            0 :         memcpy(&save_pdf14_dev, p14dev, sizeof(pdf14_device));
    5399              : 
    5400              :         /* Transparency handling with patterns confuses me, so some notes...
    5401              :          *
    5402              :          * For simple, non-transparent patterns, like you'd get in PS, we've
    5403              :          * used bitmap tiles. Draw into those tiles, and tile those out multiple
    5404              :          * times. To cope with unmarked pixels, we have a "transparency" plane
    5405              :          * (simple on/off) that says whether a pixel is marked or not.
    5406              :          *
    5407              :          * For patterns with transparency (but not blending), we can create an
    5408              :          * isolated transparency group, tile all the bitmap tiles into that, and
    5409              :          * then blend that back with the required alpha at the end. This works
    5410              :          * because the alpha values of the individual objects within the tile are
    5411              :          * recorded in that group.
    5412              :          *
    5413              :          * We can't do that for groups that use blending though, as each object
    5414              :          * in the pattern might use a different blend, and we don't (can't) record
    5415              :          * the blending mode. An isolated group doesn't even allow us to actually
    5416              :          * do the blending at all. So, for such patterns (any patterns that sets (or
    5417              :          * just has a resource that mentions) a non-normal blend mode), we use
    5418              :          * a pattern clist.
    5419              :          */
    5420            0 :         if (ptile->cdev == NULL) {
    5421            0 :             group_color_info = pdf14_clone_group_color_info(pdev, p14dev->ctx->stack->group_color_info);
    5422            0 :             if (group_color_info == NULL)
    5423              :                 return gs_error_VMerror;
    5424              : 
    5425            0 :             code = pdf14_push_transparency_group(p14dev->ctx, &rect, 1, 0, (uint16_t)floor(65535 * p14dev->alpha + 0.5),
    5426            0 :                                                  (uint16_t)floor(65535 * p14dev->shape + 0.5), (uint16_t)floor(65535 * p14dev->opacity + 0.5),
    5427              :                                                  BLEND_MODE_Normal, 0, 0, n_chan_tile - 1, false, false,
    5428              :                                                  NULL, NULL, group_color_info, pgs_noconst, pdev);
    5429            0 :             if (code < 0)
    5430              :                 return code;
    5431              :         }
    5432              : 
    5433              :         /* Set the blending procs and the is_additive setting based
    5434              :            upon the number of channels */
    5435            0 :         if (ptile->cdev == NULL) {
    5436            0 :             if (n_chan_tile-1 < 4) {

    5778              : 
    5779              : /*
    5780              :  * This open_device method for the PDF 1.4 compositor devices is only used
    5781              :  * when these devices are disabled.  This routine is about as close to
    5782              :  * a pure "forwarding" open_device operation as is possible. Its only
    5783              :  * significant function is to ensure that the is_open field of the
    5784              :  * PDF 1.4 compositor devices matches that of the target device.
    5785              :  *
    5786              :  * We assume this procedure is called only if the device is not already
    5787              :  * open, and that gs_opendevice will take care of the is_open flag.
    5788              :  */
    5789              : static  int
    5790            0 : pdf14_forward_open_device(gx_device * dev)
    5791              : {
    5792            0 :     gx_device_forward * pdev = (gx_device_forward *)dev;
    5793            0 :     gx_device * tdev = pdev->target;
    5794            0 :     int code;
    5795              : 
    5796              :     /* The PDF 1.4 compositing devices must have a target */
    5797            0 :     if (tdev == 0)
    5798              :         return_error(gs_error_unknownerror);
    5799            0 :     if ((code = gs_opendevice(tdev)) >= 0)
    5800            0 :         gx_device_copy_params(dev, tdev);
    5801              :     return code;
    5802              : }
    5803              : 
    5804              : /*
    5805              :  * Convert all device procs to be 'forwarding'.  The caller is responsible
    5806              :  * for setting any device procs that should not be forwarded.
    5807              :  */
    5808              : static  void
    5809            0 : pdf14_forward_device_procs(gx_device * dev)
    5810              : {
    5811            0 :     gx_device_forward *pdev = (gx_device_forward *)dev;
    5812            0 :     pdf14_device *p14dev = (pdf14_device*)dev;
    5813              : 
    5814              :     /* If doing simulated overprint with spot colors
    5815              :        then makes sure to reset devn setting */
    5816            0 :     if (p14dev->overprint_sim &&
    5817            0 :         p14dev->color_info.num_components > 4)
    5818            0 :         p14dev->icc_struct->supports_devn =
    5819            0 :             p14dev->target_support_devn;
    5820              : 
    5821              :     /*
    5822              :      * We are using gx_device_forward_fill_in_procs to set the various procs.
    5823              :      * This will ensure that any new device procs are also set.  However that
    5824              :      * routine only changes procs which are NULL.  Thus we start by setting all
    5825              :      * procs to NULL.
    5826              :      */
    5827            0 :     memset(&(pdev->procs), 0, size_of(pdev->procs));
    5828            0 :     gx_device_forward_fill_in_procs(pdev);
    5829              :     /*
    5830              :      * gx_device_forward_fill_in_procs does not forward all procs.
    5831              :      * Set the remainding procs to also forward.
    5832              :      */
    5833            0 :     set_dev_proc(dev, close_device, gx_forward_close_device);
    5834            0 :     set_dev_proc(dev, fill_rectangle, gx_forward_fill_rectangle);
    5835            0 :     set_dev_proc(dev, fill_rectangle_hl_color, gx_forward_fill_rectangle_hl_color);
    5836            0 :     set_dev_proc(dev, copy_mono, gx_forward_copy_mono);

    5847              : 
    5848              : /*
    5849              :  * Disable the PDF 1.4 compositor device.  Once created, the PDF 1.4
    5850              :  * compositor device is never removed.  (We do not have a remove compositor
    5851              :  * method.)  However it is no-op'ed when the PDF 1.4 device is popped.  This
    5852              :  * routine implements that action.
    5853              :  */
    5854              : int
    5855            0 : pdf14_disable_device(gx_device * dev)
    5856              : {
    5857            0 :     gx_device_forward * pdev = (gx_device_forward *)dev;
    5858              : 
    5859            0 :     if_debug0m('v', dev->memory, "[v]pdf14_disable_device\n");

    5865              : 
    5866              : /*
    5867              :  * The default color space for PDF 1.4 blend modes is based upon the process
    5868              :  * color model of the output device.
    5869              :  */
    5870              : static  pdf14_default_colorspace_t

    5875              :        define the default color space for the blend modes.  Only Gray, RGB

    6021              : /*
    6022              :  * the PDF 1.4 transparency spec says that color space for blending
    6023              :  * operations can be based upon either a color space specified in the

    6139              : 
    6140              : /* When playing back the clist, we need to know if the buffer device is compatible */
    6141              : /* with the pdf14 compositor that was used when writing the clist. Colorspace and  */
    6142              : /* depth are critical since these must match when reading back colors.             */
    6143              : bool
    6144            0 : pdf14_ok_to_optimize(gx_device *dev)
    6145              : {
    6146            0 :     pdf14_blend_cs_t blend_cs_state;
    6147            0 :     pdf14_default_colorspace_t pdf14_cs =
    6148            0 :         pdf14_determine_default_blend_cs(dev, false, &blend_cs_state);
    6149            0 :     gsicc_colorbuffer_t dev_icc_cs;
    6150            0 :     bool ok = false;
    6151            0 :     int tag_depth = device_encodes_tags(dev) ? 8 : 0;
    6152            0 :     cmm_dev_profile_t *dev_profile;
    6153            0 :     int code = dev_proc(dev, get_profile)(dev,  &dev_profile);
    6154            0 :     bool deep = device_is_deep(dev);
    6155              : 
    6156            0 :     if (code < 0)
    6157              :         return false;
    6158              : 
    6159            0 :     check_device_compatible_encoding(dev);
    6160              : 
    6161            0 :     if (dev->color_info.separable_and_linear != GX_CINFO_SEP_LIN_STANDARD)
    6162              :         return false;
    6163              : 
    6164            0 :     dev_icc_cs = dev_profile->device_profile[GS_DEFAULT_DEVICE_PROFILE]->data_cs;
    6165              :     /* If the outputprofile is not "standard" then colors converted to device color */
    6166              :     /* during clist writing won't match the colors written for the pdf14 clist dev  */
    6167            0 :     if (!(dev_icc_cs == gsGRAY || dev_icc_cs == gsRGB || dev_icc_cs == gsCMYK))
    6168              :         return false;                           /* can't handle funky output profiles */
    6169              : 
    6170            0 :     switch (pdf14_cs) {
    6171            0 :         case PDF14_DeviceGray:
    6172            0 :             ok = dev->color_info.max_gray == (deep ? 65535 : 255) && dev->color_info.depth == (8<<deep) + tag_depth;
    6173              :             break;
    6174            0 :         case PDF14_DeviceRGB:
    6175            0 :             ok = dev->color_info.max_color == (deep ? 65535: 255) && dev->color_info.depth == (24<<deep) + tag_depth;
    6176              :             break;
    6177            0 :         case PDF14_DeviceCMYK:
    6178            0 :             ok = dev->color_info.max_color == (deep ? 65535 : 255) && dev->color_info.depth == (32<<deep) + tag_depth;
    6179              :             break;
    6180              :         case PDF14_DeviceCMYKspot:
    6181              :             ok = false;                 /* punt for this case */
    6182              :             break;
    6183              :         case PDF14_DeviceRGBspot:
    6184              :             ok = false;                 /* punt for this case */
    6185              :             break;
    6186            0 :         case PDF14_DeviceCustom:
    6187              :             /*
    6188              :              * We are using the output device's process color model.  The
    6189              :              * color_info for the PDF 1.4 compositing device needs to match
    6190              :              * the output device, but it may not have been contone.
    6191              :              */
    6192            0 :             ok = dev->color_info.depth == dev->color_info.num_components * (8<<deep) + tag_depth;
    6193            0 :             break;
    6194              :         default:                        /* Should not occur */
    6195              :             ok = false;
    6196              :     }
    6197              :     return ok;
    6198              : }
    6199              : 
    6200              : /*
    6201              :  * Recreate the PDF 1.4 compositor device.  Once created, the PDF 1.4
    6202              :  * compositor device is never removed.  (We do not have a remove compositor
    6203              :  * method.)  However it is no-op'ed when the PDF 1.4 device is popped.  This
    6204              :  * routine will re-enable the compositor if the PDF 1.4 device is pushed
    6205              :  * again.
    6206              :  */
    6207              : static  int
    6208            0 : pdf14_recreate_device(gs_memory_t *mem, gs_gstate       * pgs,
    6209              :                 gx_device * dev, const gs_pdf14trans_t * pdf14pct)
    6210              : {
    6211            0 :     pdf14_device * pdev = (pdf14_device *)dev;
    6212            0 :     gx_device * target = pdev->target;
    6213            0 :     pdf14_device dev_proto;
    6214            0 :     bool has_tags = device_encodes_tags(dev);
    6215            0 :     int code;
    6216            0 :     bool deep = device_is_deep(dev);
    6217              : 
    6218            0 :     if_debug0m('v', dev->memory, "[v]pdf14_recreate_device\n");
    6219              : 
    6220              :     /*
    6221              :      * We will not use the entire prototype device but we will set the
    6222              :      * color related info and the device procs to match the prototype.
    6223              :      */
    6224            0 :     code = get_pdf14_device_proto(target, &dev_proto, pgs,
    6225              :                                   pdf14pct, false);
    6226            0 :     if (code < 0)
    6227              :         return code;
    6228            0 :     pdev->color_info = dev_proto.color_info;
    6229            0 :     pdev->pad = target->pad;
    6230            0 :     pdev->log2_align_mod = target->log2_align_mod;
    6231              : 
    6232              :     /* The prototype has the color setup without tags. If we are
    6233              :      * using tags, then we need to extend num_components and depth.
    6234              :      */
    6235            0 :     if (has_tags) {
    6236            0 :         pdev->color_info.num_components++;
    6237            0 :         pdev->color_info.depth = pdev->color_info.num_components * (deep ? 16 : 8);
    6238              :     }
    6239              : 
    6240            0 :     if (pdf14pct->params.overprint_sim_push && pdf14pct->params.num_spot_colors_int > 0 && target->num_planar_planes == 0)
    6241            0 :         pdev->num_planar_planes = dev->color_info.num_components + pdf14pct->params.num_spot_colors_int;
    6242              :     else
    6243            0 :         pdev->num_planar_planes = target->num_planar_planes;
    6244            0 :     pdev->interpolate_threshold = dev_proc(target, dev_spec_op)(target, gxdso_interpolate_threshold, NULL, 0);
    6245              : 
    6246            0 :     pdev->procs = dev_proto.procs;
    6247            0 :     if (deep) {
    6248            0 :         set_dev_proc(pdev, encode_color, pdf14_encode_color16);
    6249            0 :         set_dev_proc(pdev, decode_color, pdf14_decode_color16);
    6250              :     }
    6251            0 :     if (has_tags) {
    6252            0 :         set_dev_proc(pdev, encode_color, deep ? pdf14_encode_color16_tag : pdf14_encode_color_tag);
    6253              :     }

    6389              : /*

    6552              :        is true.

    6554              :           a BT/ET pair.  This is determined by looking at the pdf14 text_group.
    6555              :        2) The blend mode is not Normal or the opacity is not 1.0
    6556              :        3) Text knockout is set to true

    6567              :        empty. */
    6568            0 :     if (pdev->text_group == PDF14_TEXTGROUP_MISSING_ET) {

    6599              : 
    6600              : /*
    6601              :  * Implement copy_mono by filling lots of small rectangles.
    6602              :  */
    6603              : static int
    6604            0 : pdf14_copy_mono(gx_device * dev,
    6605              :                const byte * base, int sourcex, int sraster, gx_bitmap_id id,
    6606              :         int x, int y, int w, int h, gx_color_index zero, gx_color_index one)
    6607              : {
    6608            0 :     const byte *sptr;
    6609            0 :     const byte *line;
    6610            0 :     int sbit, first_bit;
    6611            0 :     int code, sbyte, bit, count;
    6612            0 :     int run_length, startx, current_bit, bit_value;
    6613            0 :     gx_color_index current_color;
    6614              : 
    6615            0 :     fit_copy(dev, base, sourcex, sraster, id, x, y, w, h);
    6616            0 :     line = base + (sourcex >> 3);
    6617            0 :     sbit = sourcex & 7;
    6618            0 :     first_bit = 7 - sbit;
    6619              : 
    6620              :     /* Loop through the height of the specified area. */
    6621            0 :     while (h-- > 0) {
    6622              :         /* Set up for the start of each line of the area. */
    6623            0 :         sptr = line;
    6624            0 :         sbyte = *sptr++;
    6625              :         /* The +1 here is 'sacrificial', we are going to decrement it by 1 immediately in
    6626              :          * the loop below so adding 1 means that we don't fall into the bit == 0
    6627              :          * case and incorrectly read a new byte from the source. This weirdness is because
    6628              :          * the original code wouold read off the end of the buffer if the number of bits in
    6629              :          * the raster was an exact multiple of 8. If it was also a multiple of the word
    6630              :          * size we might read unallocated memory. Moving the 'sbyte = *sptr++' from the end
    6631              :          * of the loop to the beginning meant we would not read past the end of the buffer
    6632              :          * because we would drop out of the 'do ... while (count-- > 0)' loop before
    6633              :          * reading another byte.
    6634              :          */
    6635            0 :         bit = first_bit + 1;
    6636            0 :         count = w;
    6637            0 :         run_length = 0;
    6638            0 :         startx = x;
    6639            0 :         current_bit = 0;
    6640            0 :         current_color = zero;
    6641              : 
    6642              :         /* Loop across each pixel of a line. */
    6643            0 :         do {
    6644              :             /* Move to the next input bit. */
    6645            0 :             if (bit == 0) {
    6646            0 :                 bit = 7;
    6647            0 :                 sbyte = *sptr++;
    6648              :             }
    6649              :             else
    6650            0 :                 bit--;
    6651            0 :             bit_value = (sbyte >> bit) & 1;
    6652            0 :             if (bit_value == current_bit) {
    6653              :                 /* The value did not change, simply increment our run length */
    6654            0 :                 run_length++;
    6655              :             } else {
    6656              :                 /* The value changed, fill the current rectangle. */
    6657            0 :                 if (run_length != 0) {
    6658            0 :                     if (current_color != gx_no_color_index) {
    6659            0 :                         code = (*dev_proc(dev, fill_rectangle))
    6660              :                                 (dev, startx, y, run_length, 1, current_color);
    6661            0 :                         if (code < 0)
    6662            0 :                             return code;
    6663              :                     }
    6664            0 :                     startx += run_length;
    6665              :                 }
    6666            0 :                 run_length = 1;
    6667            0 :                 current_color = bit_value ? one : zero;
    6668              :                 current_bit = bit_value;
    6669              :             }
    6670            0 :         } while (--count > 0);
    6671              :         /* Fill the last rectangle in the line. */
    6672            0 :         if (run_length != 0 && current_color != gx_no_color_index) {
    6673            0 :             code = (*dev_proc(dev, fill_rectangle))
    6674              :                         (dev, startx, y, run_length, 1, current_color);
    6675            0 :             if (code < 0)
    6676            0 :                 return code;
    6677              :         }
    6678              :         /* Move to the next line */
    6679            0 :         line += sraster;
    6680            0 :         y++;
    6681              :     }
    6682              :     return 0;
    6683              : }
    6684              : 
    6685              : /* Added to avoid having to go back and forth between fixed and int
    6686              :    in some of the internal methods used for dealing with tiling
    6687              :    and devn colors */
    6688              : static int
    6689            0 : pdf14_fill_rectangle_devn(gx_device *dev, int x, int y, int w, int h,
    6690              :     const gx_drawing_color *pdcolor)
    6691              : {
    6692            0 :     pdf14_device *pdev = (pdf14_device *)dev;
    6693            0 :     pdf14_buf *buf;
    6694            0 :     int code;
    6695              : 
    6696            0 :     fit_fill_xywh(dev, x, y, w, h);
    6697            0 :     if (w <= 0 || h <= 0)
    6698              :         return 0;
    6699              : 
    6700            0 :     code = pdf14_initialize_ctx(dev, NULL);
    6701            0 :     if (code < 0)
    6702              :         return code;

    6704              :

    6708              :     else
    6709            0 :         return pdf14_mark_fill_rectangle(dev, x, y, w, h, 0, pdcolor, true);
    6710              : }
    6711              : 
    6712              : /* Step through and do rect fills with the devn colors as
    6713              :    we hit each transition in the bitmap. It is possible
    6714              :    that one of the colors is not devn, but is pure and
    6715              :    is set to gx_no_color_index. This type of mix happens
    6716              :    for example from tile_clip_fill_rectangle_hl_color */
    6717              : static int
    6718            0 : pdf14_copy_mono_devn(gx_device *dev,
    6719              :     const byte *base, int sourcex, int sraster,
    6720              :     int x, int y, int w, int h, const gx_drawing_color *pdcolor0,
    6721              :     const gx_drawing_color *pdcolor1)
    6722              : {
    6723            0 :     const byte *sptr;
    6724            0 :     const byte *line;
    6725            0 :     int sbit, first_bit;
    6726            0 :     int code, sbyte, bit, count;
    6727            0 :     int run_length, startx, current_bit, bit_value;
    6728            0 :     const gx_drawing_color *current_color;
    6729              : 
    6730            0 :     if ((x | y) < 0) {
    6731            0 :         if (x < 0) {
    6732            0 :             w += x;
    6733            0 :             sourcex -= x;
    6734            0 :             x = 0;
    6735              :         }
    6736            0 :         if (y < 0) {
    6737            0 :             h += y;
    6738            0 :             base -= (int)(y * sraster);
    6739            0 :             y = 0;
    6740              :         }
    6741              :     }
    6742            0 :     if (w > (dev)->width - x)
    6743              :         w = (dev)->width - x;
    6744            0 :     if (h > (dev)->height - y)
    6745              :         h = (dev)->height - y;
    6746            0 :     if (w <= 0 || h <= 0)
    6747              :         return 0;
    6748              : 
    6749            0 :     line = base + (sourcex >> 3);
    6750            0 :     sbit = sourcex & 7;
    6751            0 :     first_bit = 7 - sbit;
    6752              : 
    6753              :     /* Loop through the height of the specified area. */
    6754            0 :     while (h-- > 0) {
    6755              :         /* Set up for the start of each line of the area. */
    6756            0 :         sptr = line;
    6757            0 :         sbyte = *sptr++;
    6758            0 :         bit = first_bit;
    6759            0 :         count = w;
    6760            0 :         run_length = 0;
    6761            0 :         startx = x;
    6762            0 :         current_bit = 0;
    6763            0 :         current_color = pdcolor0;
    6764              : 
    6765              :         /* Loop across each pixel of a line. */
    6766            0 :         do {
    6767            0 :             bit_value = (sbyte >> bit) & 1;
    6768            0 :             if (bit_value == current_bit) {
    6769              :                 /* The value did not change, simply increment our run length */
    6770            0 :                 run_length++;
    6771              :             } else {
    6772              :                 /* The value changed, fill the current rectangle. */
    6773            0 :                 if (run_length != 0) {
    6774            0 :                     if (current_color->type != gx_dc_type_pure &&
    6775            0 :                         current_color->colors.pure != gx_no_color_index) {
    6776            0 :                         code = pdf14_fill_rectangle_devn(dev, startx, y,
    6777              :                             run_length, 1, current_color);
    6778            0 :                         if (code < 0)
    6779            0 :                             return code;
    6780              :                     }
    6781            0 :                     startx += run_length;
    6782              :                 }
    6783            0 :                 run_length = 1;
    6784            0 :                 current_color = bit_value ? pdcolor1 : pdcolor0;
    6785              :                 current_bit = bit_value;
    6786              :             }
    6787              : 
    6788              :             /* Move to the next input bit. */
    6789            0 :             if (bit == 0) {
    6790            0 :                 bit = 7;
    6791            0 :                 sbyte = *sptr++;
    6792              :             } else
    6793            0 :                 bit--;
    6794            0 :         } while (--count > 0);
    6795              : 
    6796              :         /* Fill the last rectangle in the line. */
    6797            0 :         if (run_length != 0 && current_color->type != gx_dc_type_pure &&
    6798            0 :             current_color->colors.pure != gx_no_color_index) {
    6799            0 :             code = pdf14_fill_rectangle_devn(dev, startx, y,
    6800              :                 run_length, 1, current_color);
    6801            0 :             if (code < 0)
    6802            0 :                 return code;
    6803              :         }
    6804              :         /* Move to the next line */
    6805            0 :         line += sraster;
    6806            0 :         y++;
    6807              :     }
    6808              :     return 0;
    6809              : }
    6810              : 
    6811              : /* Step through the tiles doing essentially copy_mono but with devn colors */
    6812              : static int
    6813            0 : pdf14_impl_strip_tile_rectangle_devn(gx_device *dev, const gx_strip_bitmap *tiles,
    6814              :     int x, int y, int w, int h, const gx_drawing_color *pdcolor0,
    6815              :     const gx_drawing_color *pdcolor1, int px, int py)
    6816              : {   /* Fill the rectangle in chunks. */
    6817            0 :     int width = tiles->size.x;
    6818            0 :     int height = tiles->size.y;
    6819            0 :     int raster = tiles->raster;
    6820            0 :     int rwidth = tiles->rep_width;
    6821            0 :     int rheight = tiles->rep_height;
    6822            0 :     int shift = tiles->shift;
    6823              : 
    6824            0 :     if (rwidth == 0 || rheight == 0)
    6825              :         return_error(gs_error_unregistered);
    6826            0 :     fit_fill_xy(dev, x, y, w, h);
    6827              : 
    6828              :      {
    6829            0 :         int xoff = (shift == 0 ? px :
    6830            0 :                 px + (y + py) / rheight * tiles->rep_shift);
    6831            0 :         int irx = ((rwidth & (rwidth - 1)) == 0 ? /* power of 2 */
    6832            0 :             (x + xoff) & (rwidth - 1) :
    6833            0 :             (x + xoff) % rwidth);
    6834            0 :         int ry = ((rheight & (rheight - 1)) == 0 ? /* power of 2 */
    6835            0 :             (y + py) & (rheight - 1) :
    6836            0 :             (y + py) % rheight);
    6837            0 :         int icw = width - irx;
    6838            0 :         int ch = height - ry;
    6839            0 :         byte *row = tiles->data + ry * raster;
    6840            0 :         int code = 0;
    6841              : 
    6842            0 :         if (ch >= h) {      /* Shallow operation */
    6843            0 :             if (icw >= w) { /* Just one (partial) tile to transfer. */
    6844            0 :                 code = pdf14_copy_mono_devn(dev, row, irx, raster, x, y,
    6845              :                     w, h, pdcolor0, pdcolor1);
    6846            0 :                 if (code < 0)
    6847              :                     return_error(code);
    6848              :             } else {
    6849            0 :                 int ex = x + w;
    6850            0 :                 int fex = ex - width;
    6851            0 :                 int cx = x + icw;
    6852              : 
    6853            0 :                 code = pdf14_copy_mono_devn(dev, row, irx, raster,
    6854              :                     x, y, icw, h, pdcolor0, pdcolor1);
    6855            0 :                 if (code < 0)
    6856              :                     return_error(code);
    6857              : 
    6858            0 :                 while (cx <= fex) {
    6859            0 :                     code = pdf14_copy_mono_devn(dev, row, 0, raster, cx, y,
    6860              :                         width, h, pdcolor0, pdcolor1);
    6861            0 :                     if (code < 0)
    6862            0 :                         return_error(code);
    6863            0 :                     cx += width;
    6864              :                 }
    6865            0 :                 if (cx < ex) {
    6866            0 :                     code = pdf14_copy_mono_devn(dev, row, 0, raster, cx, y,
    6867              :                         ex - cx, h, pdcolor0, pdcolor1);
    6868            0 :                     if (code < 0)
    6869              :                         return_error(code);
    6870              :                 }
    6871              :             }
    6872            0 :         } else if (icw >= w && shift == 0) {
    6873              :             /* Narrow operation, no shift */
    6874            0 :             int ey = y + h;
    6875            0 :             int fey = ey - height;
    6876            0 :             int cy = y + ch;
    6877              : 
    6878            0 :             code = pdf14_copy_mono_devn(dev, row, irx, raster,
    6879              :                 x, y, w, ch, pdcolor0, pdcolor1);
    6880            0 :             if (code < 0)
    6881              :                 return_error(code);
    6882            0 :             row = tiles->data;
    6883            0 :             do {
    6884            0 :                 ch = (cy > fey ? ey - cy : height);
    6885            0 :                 code = pdf14_copy_mono_devn(dev, row, irx, raster,
    6886              :                     x, cy, w, ch, pdcolor0, pdcolor1);
    6887            0 :                 if (code < 0)
    6888            0 :                     return_error(code);
    6889            0 :             } while ((cy += ch) < ey);
    6890              :         } else {
    6891              :             /* Full operation.  If shift != 0, some scan lines */
    6892              :             /* may be narrow.  We could test shift == 0 in advance */
    6893              :             /* and use a slightly faster loop, but right now */
    6894              :             /* we don't bother. */
    6895            0 :             int ex = x + w, ey = y + h;
    6896            0 :             int fex = ex - width, fey = ey - height;
    6897            0 :             int cx, cy;

    6925            0 :                 if ((cy += ch) >= ey)

    7123            0 :     if (rect->q.y < rect->p.y)

    7127              : 
    7128              : static  int
    7129            0 : compute_group_device_int_rect(pdf14_device *pdev, gs_int_rect *rect,

    7533              :         PDF14 device */

    7888            0 :    pdf14_pop_group_color(dev, pgs);
    7889            0 :     return 0;
    7890              : }
    7891              : 
    7892              : /* When a transparency group is popped, the parent colorprocs must be restored.
    7893              :    Since the color mapping procs are all based upon the device, we must have a
    7894              :    nested list based upon the transparency group color space.  This nesting
    7895              :    must be outside the nested ctx structures to allow the nesting for the
    7896              :    clist writer */
    7897              : static void
    7898            0 : pdf14_pop_group_color(gx_device *dev, const gs_gstate *pgs)
    7899              : {
    7900            0 :     pdf14_device *pdev = (pdf14_device *)dev;
    7901            0 :     pdf14_group_color_t *group_color = pdev->color_model_stack;
    7902              :

    8071            0 : do_mark_fill_rectangle_ko_simple(gx_device *dev, int x, int y, int w, int h,

    8101            0 :     byte shape = 0; /* Quiet compiler. */

    8204            0 :                         dst2[k] = dst[k] = 255 - bg_ptr[k * planestride];

    8213              :             }

    8216            0 :                 if (!overprint) {
    8217            0 :                     for (k = 0; k < num_chan; ++k)
    8218            0 :                         dst_ptr[k * planestride] = dst[k];
    8219              :                 } else {

    8221              :                     /* We may have to do the compatible overprint blending */

    8229              :                         } else {
    8230              :                             /* Compatible overprint blend result. */
    8231            0 :                             dst_ptr[k * planestride] = dst2[k];
    8232              :                         }
    8233              :                     }
    8234            0 :                     dst_ptr[num_comp * planestride] = dst[num_comp];    /* alpha */

    8237            0 :                 if (overprint) {
    8238              :                     /* We may have to do the compatible overprint blending */

    8241              :                             blend_mode, pdev->blend_procs, pdev);

    8245            0 :                             dst_ptr[k * planestride] = 255 - dst[k];
    8246              :                         } else {
    8247              :                             /* Compatible overprint blend result. */
    8248            0 :                             dst_ptr[k * planestride] = 255 - dst2[k];
    8249              :                         }
    8250              :                     }
    8251              :                 } else {
    8252            0 :                     for (k = 0; k < num_comp; ++k)
    8253            0 :                         dst_ptr[k * planestride] = 255 - dst[k];
    8254              :                 }
    8255            0 :                 dst_ptr[num_comp * planestride] = dst[num_comp];
    8256              :             }
    8257            0 :             if (tag_off) {
    8258              :                 /* If src alpha is 100% then set to curr_tag, else or */
    8259              :                 /* other than Normal BM, we always OR */
    8260            0 :                 if (src[num_comp] == 255 && tag_blend) {
    8261            0 :                     dst_ptr[tag_off] = curr_tag;
    8262              :                 } else {
    8263            0 :                     dst_ptr[tag_off] |= curr_tag;
    8264              :                 }
    8265              :             }
    8266              :             /* Knockout group alpha and shape too */
    8267            0 :             if (alpha_g_off)

    8269            0 :             if (shape_off)
    8270            0 :                 dst_ptr[shape_off] = 255 - shape;
    8271            0 :             ++dst_ptr;
    8272            0 :             if (has_backdrop)
    8273            0 :                 ++bg_ptr;
    8274              :         }

    8276            0 :         line += rowstride;

    8293              : static  int
    8294            0 : do_mark_fill_rectangle_ko_simple16(gx_device *dev, int x, int y, int w, int h,
    8295              :                                    gx_color_index color,
    8296              :                                    const gx_device_color *pdc, bool devn)

    8300            0 :     gs_blend_mode_t blend_mode = pdev->blend_mode;

    8307            0 :     uint16_t dst[PDF14_MAX_PLANES] = { 0 };
    8308            0 :     uint16_t dst2[PDF14_MAX_PLANES] = { 0 };

    8702              : static  void
    8703            0 : pdf14_cmap_cmyk_direct(frac c, frac m, frac y, frac k, gx_device_color * pdc,
    8704              :      const gs_gstate * pgs, gx_device * dev, gs_color_select_t select,

    8708            0 :     frac cm_comps[GX_DEVICE_COLOR_MAX_COMPONENTS];

    8714              :

    8717            0 :     if (pgs->trans_device != NULL){
    8718            0 :         trans_device = pgs->trans_device;

    8723              :

    9426              : /*

    9440              : /*
    9441              :  * Check for equality of two PDF 1.4 transparency compositor objects.
    9442              :  *
    9443              :  * We are currently always indicating that PDF 1.4 transparency compositors are
    9444              :  * equal.  Two transparency compositors may have teh same data but still
    9445              :  * represent separate actions.  (E.g. two PDF14_BEGIN_TRANS_GROUP compositor
    9446              :  * operations in a row mean that we are creating a group inside of a group.
    9447              :  */
    9448              : static  bool

    9451            0 :     return false;
    9452              : }

    9462              :     END
    9463              : 
    9464              : static inline int

    9483              : 
    9484              : /*
    9485              :  * Convert a PDF 1.4 transparency compositor to string form for use by the command
    9486              :  * list device. This is also where we update the pdf14_needed. When set the clist
    9487              :  * painting procs will update the trans_bbox state for bands that are affected.
    9488              : */
    9489              : static  int
    9490            0 : c_pdf14trans_write(const gs_composite_t * pct, byte * data, uint * psize,
    9491              :                    gx_device_clist_writer *cdev)
    9492              : {
    9493            0 :     const gs_pdf14trans_params_t * pparams = &((const gs_pdf14trans_t *)pct)->params;

    9495            0 :     byte buf[MAX_CLIST_TRANSPARENCY_BUFFER_SIZE]; /* Must be large enough

    9499            0 :     byte * pbuf = buf;

    9746              :  * Convert the string representation of the PDF 1.4 transparency parameter
    9747              :  * into the full compositor.
    9748              :  */
    9749              : static  int
    9750            0 : c_pdf14trans_read(gs_composite_t * * ppct, const byte * data,
    9751              :                                 uint size, gs_memory_t * mem )

    9753            0 :     gs_pdf14trans_params_t params = {0};

    9758            0 :     if (size < 1)

    9869              :             break;

    9871              :             return 0;
    9872              :             break;
    9873              :         case PDF14_POP_SMASK_COLOR:
    9874              :             return 0;
    9875            0 :             break;
    9876              :         case PDF14_SET_BLEND_PARAMS:
    9877            0 :             read_value(data, params.changed);
    9878            0 :             if (params.changed & PDF14_SET_BLEND_MODE)
    9879            0 :                 params.blend_mode = *data++;
    9880            0 :             if (params.changed & PDF14_SET_TEXT_KNOCKOUT)
    9881            0 :                 params.text_knockout = *data++;
    9882            0 :             if (params.changed & PDF14_SET_AIS)
    9883            0 :                 read_value(data, params.ais);
    9884            0 :             if (params.changed & PDF14_SET_OVERPRINT)
    9885            0 :                 read_value(data, params.overprint);
    9886            0 :             if (params.changed & PDF14_SET_STROKEOVERPRINT)
    9887            0 :                 read_value(data, params.stroke_overprint);

    9897            0 :     if (code < 0)

    9903            0 :     if ( used + 3 > MAX_CLIST_COMPOSITOR_SIZE )
    9904              :         return_error(gs_error_rangecheck);
    9905              :     else
    9906              :         return used;

    9908              : 
    9909              : /*
    9910              :  * Adjust the compositor's CTM.
    9911              :  */
    9912              : static int
    9913            0 : c_pdf14trans_adjust_ctm(gs_composite_t * pct0, int x0, int y0, gs_gstate *pgs)
    9914              : {
    9915            0 :     gs_pdf14trans_t *pct = (gs_pdf14trans_t *)pct0;
    9916            0 :     gs_matrix mat = pct->params.ctm;
    9917              : 
    9918            0 :     if_debug6m('L', pgs->memory, " [%g %g %g %g %g %g]\n",
    9919              :                mat.xx, mat.xy, mat.yx, mat.yy,
    9920              :                mat.tx, mat.ty);
    9921            0 :     mat.tx -= x0;
    9922            0 :     mat.ty -= y0;
    9923            0 :     gs_gstate_setmatrix(pgs, &mat);
    9924            0 :     return 0;
    9925              : }
    9926              : 
    9927              : /*
    9928              :  * Create a PDF 1.4 transparency compositor.
    9929              :  *
    9930              :  * Note that this routine will be called only if the device is not already
    9931              :  * a PDF 1.4 transparency compositor.
    9932              :  * Return an error if it is not a PDF14_PUSH_DEVICE operation.
    9933              :  */
    9934              : static  int

   10129              : /*
   10130              :  * Methods for the PDF 1.4 transparency compositor
   10131              :  *

   10133              :  * composite_clist_write_update method.  Once the clist write device is created,

   10226              : 
   10227              : /* ------------- PDF 1.4 transparency device for clist writing ------------- */
   10228              : 
   10229              : /*
   10230              :  * The PDF 1.4 transparency compositor device may have a different process
   10231              :  * color model than the output device.  If we are banding then we need to
   10232              :  * create two compositor devices.  The output side (clist reader) needs a
   10233              :  * compositor to actually composite the output.  We also need a compositor
   10234              :  * device before the clist writer.  This is needed to provide a process color
   10235              :  * model which matches the PDF 1.4 blending space.
   10236              :  *
   10237              :  * This section provides support for this device.
   10238              :  */
   10239              : 
   10240              : /*
   10241              :  * Define the default pre-clist (clist writer) PDF 1.4 compositing device.
   10242              :  * We actually use the same structure for both the clist writer and reader
   10243              :  * devices.  However we use separate names to identify the routines for each
   10244              :  * device.
   10245              :  */
   10246              : 
   10247              : static  dev_proc_composite(pdf14_clist_composite);

   10479              : 
   10480              : /*
   10481              :  * the PDF 1.4 transparency spec says that color space for blending
   10482              :  * operations can be based upon either a color space specified in the
   10483              :  * group or a default value based upon the output device.  We are
   10484              :  * currently only using a color space based upon the device.
   10485              :  */
   10486              : static  int
   10487            0 : get_pdf14_clist_device_proto(gx_device          *dev,
   10488              :                              pdf14_clist_device *pdevproto,
   10489              :                              gs_gstate          *pgs,
   10490              :                        const gs_pdf14trans_t    *pdf14pct,
   10491              :                              bool                use_pdf14_accum)
   10492              : {
   10493            0 :     pdf14_blend_cs_t blend_cs_state;
   10494            0 :     pdf14_default_colorspace_t dev_cs =
   10495            0 :                 pdf14_determine_default_blend_cs(dev, use_pdf14_accum,
   10496              :                                                  &blend_cs_state);
   10497            0 :     bool deep = device_is_deep(dev);
   10498            0 :     int num_spots = pdf14pct->params.num_spot_colors;
   10499              : 
   10500              :     /* overprint overide */
   10501            0 :     if (pdf14pct->params.overprint_sim_push &&
   10502            0 :         blend_cs_state == PDF14_BLEND_CS_UNSPECIFIED) {
   10503            0 :         int has_tags = device_encodes_tags(dev);
   10504            0 :         if (pdf14pct->params.num_spot_colors_int > 0) {
   10505              :             dev_cs = PDF14_DeviceCMYKspot;
   10506              :             num_spots = pdf14pct->params.num_spot_colors_int;
   10507              :         } else
   10508              :             dev_cs = PDF14_DeviceCMYK;
   10509              :     }
   10510              : 
   10511            0 :     switch (dev_cs) {
   10512            0 :         case PDF14_DeviceGray:

   10514              :                initialization of gray device prototype is
   10515              :                peculiar in that in dci_std_color_num_components
   10516              :                the comment is
   10517              :               "A device is monochrome only if it is bi-level"
   10518              :               Here we want monochrome anytime we have a gray device.
   10519              :               To avoid breaking things elsewhere, we will overide
   10520              :               the prototype intialization here */
   10521            0 :             *pdevproto = pdf14_clist_Gray_device;
   10522            0 :             pdevproto->color_info.max_components = 1;
   10523            0 :             pdevproto->color_info.num_components =
   10524              :                                     pdevproto->color_info.max_components;

   10543              :             break;

   10547            0 :             pdevproto->sep_device = false;
   10548            0 :             if (deep) {
   10549            0 :                 pdevproto->color_info.depth = 4*16;
   10550            0 :                 pdevproto->color_info.max_color = 65535;
   10551            0 :                 pdevproto->color_info.max_gray = 65535;
   10552            0 :                 pdevproto->color_info.dither_colors = 65536;
   10553            0 :                 pdevproto->color_info.dither_grays = 65536;
   10554              :             }
   10555              :             break;
   10556            0 :         case PDF14_DeviceCMYKspot:
   10557            0 :             *pdevproto = pdf14_clist_CMYKspot_device;
   10558              :             /*
   10559              :              * The number of components for the PDF14 device is the sum
   10560              :              * of the process components and the number of spot colors
   10561              :              * for the page. If we are using an NCLR ICC profile at
   10562              :              * the output device, those spot colors are skipped. They
   10563              :              * do not appear in the transparency buffer, but appear
   10564              :              * during put image transform of the page group to the target
   10565              :              * color space.
   10566              :              */

   10576            0 :                               pdevproto->color_info.num_components * (8<<deep);
   10577              :             }
   10578            0 :             pdevproto->color_info.anti_alias = dev->color_info.anti_alias;

   10585              :              * of the process components and the number of spot colors
   10586              :              * for the page. If we are using an NCLR ICC profile at
   10587              :              * the output device, those spot colors are skipped. They
   10588              :              * do not appear in the transparency buffer, but appear
   10589              :              * during put image transform of the page group to the target
   10590              :              * color space.
   10591              :              */

   10605            0 :             break;
   10606            0 :         case PDF14_DeviceCustom:

   10608              :              * We are using the output device's process color model.  The
   10609              :              * color_info for the PDF 1.4 compositing device needs to match
   10610              :              * the output device.
   10611              :              */
   10612            0 :             *pdevproto = pdf14_clist_custom_device;
   10613            0 :             pdevproto->color_info = dev->color_info;
   10614              :             /* The pdf14 device has to be 8 (or 16) bit continuous tone. Force it */
   10615            0 :             pdevproto->color_info.depth =
   10616            0 :                 pdevproto->color_info.num_components * (8<<deep);
   10617            0 :             pdevproto->color_info.max_gray = deep ? 65535 : 255;

   10622            0 :             break;

   10624              :             return_error(gs_error_rangecheck);
   10625              :     }
   10626            0 :     pdevproto->overprint_sim = pdf14pct->params.overprint_sim_push;
   10627            0 :     pdevproto->blend_cs_state = blend_cs_state;
   10628            0 :     return 0;
   10629              : }
   10630              : 
   10631              : static  int
   10632            0 : pdf14_create_clist_device(gs_memory_t *mem, gs_gstate * pgs,
   10633              :                                 gx_device ** ppdev, gx_device * target,
   10634              :                                 const gs_pdf14trans_t * pdf14pct)
   10635              : {
   10636            0 :     pdf14_clist_device dev_proto;
   10637            0 :     pdf14_clist_device * pdev;
   10638            0 :     int code;
   10639            0 :     bool has_tags = device_encodes_tags(target);
   10640            0 :     cmm_profile_t *target_profile;
   10641            0 :     gsicc_rendering_param_t render_cond;
   10642            0 :     cmm_dev_profile_t *dev_profile;
   10643            0 :     uchar k;
   10644            0 :     bool deep = device_is_deep(target);
   10645            0 :     cmm_profile_t *icc_profile;
   10646              : 
   10647              : 
   10648            0 :     code = dev_proc(target, get_profile)(target,  &dev_profile);
   10649            0 :     if (code < 0)
   10650              :         return code;
   10651            0 :     gsicc_extract_profile(GS_UNKNOWN_TAG, dev_profile, &target_profile,
   10652              :                           &render_cond);
   10653            0 :     if_debug0m('v', pgs->memory, "[v]pdf14_create_clist_device\n");
   10654              :     /* Prototypes never include tags. We add those in later. */
   10655            0 :     code = get_pdf14_clist_device_proto(target, &dev_proto,
   10656              :                                         pgs, pdf14pct, false);
   10657            0 :     if (code < 0)
   10658              :         return code;
   10659            0 :     code = gs_copydevice((gx_device **) &pdev,
   10660              :                          (const gx_device *) &dev_proto, mem);
   10661            0 :     if (code < 0)
   10662              :         return code;
   10663              : 
   10664              :     /* If we are not using a blending color space, the number of color planes
   10665              :        should not exceed that of the target */
   10666            0 :     if (!(pdev->blend_cs_state != PDF14_BLEND_CS_UNSPECIFIED || pdev->overprint_sim)) {
   10667            0 :         if (pdev->color_info.num_components > target->color_info.num_components - device_encodes_tags(target) + device_encodes_tags((gx_device *)pdev))
   10668            0 :             pdev->color_info.num_components = target->color_info.num_components - device_encodes_tags(target) + device_encodes_tags((gx_device *)pdev);
   10669            0 :         if (pdev->color_info.max_components > target->color_info.max_components)
   10670            0 :             pdev->color_info.max_components = target->color_info.max_components;
   10671              :     }
   10672            0 :     pdev->color_info.depth = pdev->color_info.num_components * (8<<deep);
   10673            0 :     pdev->pad = target->pad;
   10674            0 :     pdev->log2_align_mod = target->log2_align_mod;
   10675              : 
   10676            0 :     if (pdf14pct->params.overprint_sim_push && pdf14pct->params.num_spot_colors_int > 0 && target->num_planar_planes == 0)
   10677            0 :         pdev->num_planar_planes = pdev->color_info.num_components + pdf14pct->params.num_spot_colors_int;
   10678              :     else
   10679            0 :         pdev->num_planar_planes = target->num_planar_planes;
   10680            0 :     pdev->interpolate_threshold = dev_proc(target, dev_spec_op)(target, gxdso_interpolate_threshold, NULL, 0);
   10681              : 
   10682            0 :     pdev->op_state = pgs->is_fill_color ? PDF14_OP_STATE_FILL : PDF14_OP_STATE_NONE;
   10683              : 
   10684            0 :     if (deep) {
   10685            0 :         set_dev_proc(pdev, encode_color, pdf14_encode_color16);
   10686            0 :         set_dev_proc(pdev, decode_color, pdf14_decode_color16);
   10687              :     }
   10688              :     /* If we have a tag device then go ahead and do a special encoder decoder
   10689              :        for the pdf14 device to make sure we maintain this information in the
   10690              :        encoded color information.  We could use the target device's methods but
   10691              :        the PDF14 device has to maintain 8 bit color always and we could run
   10692              :        into other issues if the number of colorants became large.  If we need to
   10693              :        do compressed color with tags that will be a special project at that time */
   10694            0 :     if (has_tags) {
   10695            0 :         set_dev_proc(pdev, encode_color, deep ? pdf14_encode_color16_tag: pdf14_encode_color_tag);
   10696              :     }
   10697            0 :     pdev->color_info.separable_and_linear = GX_CINFO_SEP_LIN_STANDARD;       /* this is the standard */
   10698            0 :     gx_device_fill_in_procs((gx_device *)pdev);
   10699              :     /* Copying the params adds the tags to the color_info if required. */
   10700            0 :     gs_pdf14_device_copy_params((gx_device *)pdev, target);
   10701            0 :     gx_device_set_target((gx_device_forward *)pdev, target);
   10702              : 
   10703              :     /* Components shift, etc have to be based upon 8 bit */
   10704            0 :     for (k = 0; k < pdev->color_info.num_components; k++) {
   10705            0 :         pdev->color_info.comp_bits[k] = 8<<deep;
   10706            0 :         pdev->color_info.comp_shift[k] = (pdev->color_info.num_components - 1 - k) * (8<<deep);
   10707              :     }
   10708            0 :     code = dev_proc((gx_device *) pdev, open_device) ((gx_device *) pdev);
   10709            0 :     if (code < 0)
   10710              :         return code;
   10711            0 :     pdev->pclist_device = target;
   10712              : 
   10713            0 :     code = dev_proc(target, get_profile)(target, &dev_profile);
   10714            0 :     if (code < 0)
   10715              :         return code;
   10716            0 :     gsicc_extract_profile(GS_UNKNOWN_TAG, dev_profile, &icc_profile,
   10717              :         &render_cond);
   10718            0 :     if_debug0m('v', mem, "[v]pdf14_create_clist_device\n");
   10719              : 
   10720              :     /* Simulated overprint case.  We have to use CMYK-based profile
   10721              :        Also if the target profile is NCLR, we are going to use a pdf14
   10722              :        device that is CMYK based and do the mapping to the NCLR profile
   10723              :        when the put_image occurs */
   10724            0 :     if ((pdev->overprint_sim && icc_profile->data_cs != gsCMYK) ||
   10725            0 :          icc_profile->data_cs == gsNCHANNEL) {
   10726            0 :         gsicc_adjust_profile_rc(pgs->icc_manager->default_cmyk, 1, "pdf14_create_clist_device");
   10727            0 :         gsicc_adjust_profile_rc(pdev->icc_struct->device_profile[GS_DEFAULT_DEVICE_PROFILE],
   10728              :             -1, "pdf14_create_clist_device");
   10729            0 :         pdev->icc_struct->device_profile[GS_DEFAULT_DEVICE_PROFILE] = pgs->icc_manager->default_cmyk;
   10730              :     } else {
   10731              :         /* If the target profile was CIELAB, then overide with default RGB for
   10732              :            proper blending.  During put_image we will convert from RGB to
   10733              :            CIELAB */

   11010              : /*
   11011              :  * This procedure will have information from the PDF 1.4 clist writing
   11012              :  * clist compositior device.  This is information output the compressed
   11013              :  * color list info which is needed for the support of spot colors in
   11014              :  * PDF 1.4 compositing.  This info needs to be passed to the PDF 1.4
   11015              :  * clist reading compositor.  However this device is not created until
   11016              :  * the clist is read.  To get this info to that device, we have to

   11030              : /*

   11894            0 :         (void)gs_setblendmode(pgs, blend_mode); /* Can never fail */
   11895              :

   11897            0 :             (void)gs_setfillconstantalpha(pgs, fill_alpha);

   11908            0 :                 goto cleanup;

   11910            0 :             if ((dev->icc_struct->overprint_control != gs_overprint_control_disable) &&
   11911            0 :                 pgs->overprint &&
   11912            0 :                 dev->color_info.polarity == GX_CINFO_POLARITY_SUBTRACTIVE)
   11913            0 :                 (void)gs_setblendmode(pgs, blend_mode); /* Can never fail */
   11914              :         }
   11915              : 
   11916            0 :         if (stroke_alpha > 0.0) {
   11917              :             /* Note that the stroke can end up looking like a fill here */
   11918            0 :             (void)gs_setstrokeconstantalpha(pgs, stroke_alpha);
   11919            0 :             (void)gs_setfillconstantalpha(pgs, stroke_alpha);
   11920              : 
   11921            0 :             if (pgs->overprint && dev->color_info.polarity == GX_CINFO_POLARITY_SUBTRACTIVE)
   11922            0 :                 (void)gs_setblendmode(pgs, BLEND_MODE_CompatibleOverprint); /* Can never fail */
   11923              : 
   11924            0 :             code = pdf14_clist_stroke_path(dev, pgs, ppath, params_stroke, pdevc_stroke, pcpath);

   11926            0 :                 goto cleanup;
   11927              : 
   11928            0 :             if ((dev->icc_struct->overprint_control != gs_overprint_control_disable) &&
   11929            0 :                 pgs->overprint &&
   11930            0 :                 dev->color_info.polarity == GX_CINFO_POLARITY_SUBTRACTIVE)
   11931            0 :                 (void)gs_setblendmode(pgs, blend_mode); /* Can never fail */
   11932              :         }
   11933              :     }
   11934              : 
   11935            0 : cleanup:
   11936              :     /* Now during the pop do the compositing with alpha of 1.0 and normal blend */
   11937            0 :     (void)gs_setfillconstantalpha(pgs, 1.0);
   11938            0 :     (void)gs_setstrokeconstantalpha(pgs, 1.0);
   11939            0 :     (void)gs_setblendmode(pgs, BLEND_MODE_Normal); /* Can never fail */
   11940              : 
   11941              :     /* Restore where we were. If an error occured while in the group push
   11942              :        return that error code but try to do the cleanup */
   11943            0 :     code2 = gs_end_transparency_group(pgs);

   12262              : /*
   12263              :  * When we push a PDF 1.4 transparency compositor onto the clist, we also need
   12264              :  * to create a compositing device for clist writing.  The primary purpose of
   12265              :  * this device is to provide support for the process color model in which
   12266              :  * the PDF 1.4 transparency is done.  (This may differ from the process color
   12267              :  * model of the output device.)  The actual work of compositing the image is
   12268              :  * done on the output (reader) side of the clist.
   12269              :  */
   12270              : static  int
   12271            0 : c_pdf14trans_clist_write_update(const gs_composite_t * pcte, gx_device * dev,
   12272              :                 gx_device ** pcdev, gs_gstate * pgs, gs_memory_t * mem)
   12273              : {
   12274            0 :     gx_device_clist_writer * const cdev = &((gx_device_clist *)dev)->writer;

   12276            0 :     int code = 0;
   12277              : 
   12278              :     /* We only handle the push/pop operations */
   12279            0 :     switch (pdf14pct->params.pdf14_op) {
   12280            0 :         case PDF14_PUSH_DEVICE:
   12281            0 :             code = gs_pdf14_clist_device_push(mem, pgs, pcdev, dev, pdf14pct);
   12282              :             /* Change (non-error) code to 1 to indicate that we created
   12283              :              * a device. */
   12284            0 :             if (code >= 0)
   12285            0 :                 code = 1;
   12286              :             return code;
   12287              : 
   12288            0 :         case PDF14_POP_DEVICE:
   12289            0 :             code = clist_writer_check_empty_cropping_stack(cdev);
   12290            0 :             break;

   12298              : 
   12299            0 :                 pdf14pct_noconst = (gs_pdf14trans_t *) pcte;

   12301              :                    softmask group through which this transparency

   12337              :             code = 0; /* A place for breakpoint. */

   12364              : 
   12365              : /*
   12366              :  * When we push a PDF 1.4 transparency compositor, we need to make the clist
   12367              :  * device color_info data match the compositing device.  We need to do this
   12368              :  * since the PDF 1.4 transparency compositing device may use a different
   12369              :  * process color model than the output device.  We do not need to modify the
   12370              :  * color related device procs since the compositing device has its own.  We
   12371              :  * restore the color_info data when the transparency device is popped.
   12372              :  */
   12373              : static  int
   12374            0 : c_pdf14trans_clist_read_update(gs_composite_t * pcte, gx_device * cdev,
   12375              :                 gx_device * tdev, gs_gstate * pgs, gs_memory_t * mem)
   12376              : {
   12377            0 :     pdf14_device * p14dev = (pdf14_device *)tdev;

   12419              :              * supports spot colors) then we need to transfer
   12420              :              * color info from the clist PDF 1.4 compositing reader device
   12421              :              * to the clist writer PDF 1.4 compositing device.
   12422              :              * This info was transfered from that device to the output
   12423              :              * device as a set of device parameters.  However the clist
   12424              :              * reader PDF 1.4 compositing device did not exist when the
   12425              :              * device parameters were read from the clist.  So that info
   12426              :              * was buffered into the output device.
   12427              :              */
   12428            0 :             pclist_devn_params = dev_proc(cdev, ret_devn_params)(cdev);

   12433              :                  * The number of components for the PDF14 device is the sum
   12434              :                  * of the process components and the number of spot colors
   12435              :                  * for the page.  If the color capabilities of the parent
   12436              :                  * device (which coming into this are the same as the p14dev)
   12437              :                  * are smaller than the number of page spot colors then
   12438              :                  * use that for the number of components. Otherwise use

   12440              :                  * the sICCOutputColors setting, then just use that, which

   12478              :                        will have already created these but they are the wrong size.
   12479              :                        We must destroy them though before reopening the device."

   12481              :                        doesn't show ill effects from not doing it. Indeed, Bug 707790

   12521              : /*

   12524              : static  int
   12525            0 : c_pdf14trans_get_cropping(const gs_composite_t *pcte, int *ry, int *rheight,
   12526              :                           int cropping_min, int cropping_max)
   12527              : {
   12528            0 :     gs_pdf14trans_t * pdf14pct = (gs_pdf14trans_t *) pcte;

   12531              :         case PDF14_POP_DEVICE:  return ALLBANDS; /* Applies to all bands. */
   12532              :         case PDF14_ABORT_DEVICE: return ALLBANDS; /* Applies to all bands */

   12553            0 :                 pdf14_compute_group_device_int_rect(&pdf14pct->params.ctm,
   12554            0 :                                                     &pdf14pct->params.bbox, &rect);

   12589              : }
   12590              : 
   12591              : /*
   12592              :  * This routine will check to see if the color component name matches those
   12593              :  * that are available amoung the current device's color components.  If the
   12594              :  * color name is known to the output device then we add it to the list of
   12595              :  * colorants for the PDF 1.4 transparency compositor.
   12596              :  *
   12597              :  * Notes:  There are currently three different versions of The PDF 1.4
   12598              :  * transparency compositor device.  The choice of which one is being used
   12599              :  * depends upon the process color model of the output device.  This procedure
   12600              :  * is only used if the output (target) device uses a CMYK, or RGB or Gray
   12601              :  * plus spot color process color model.
   12602              :  *
   12603              :  * Parameters:
   12604              :  *   dev - pointer to device data structure.
   12605              :  *   pname - pointer to name (zero termination not required)
   12606              :  *   nlength - length of the name
   12607              :  *   number of process colorants (either 1, 3, or 4)
   12608              :  *
   12609              :  * This routine returns a positive value (0 to n) which is the device colorant
   12610              :  * number if the name is found.  It returns GX_DEVICE_COLOR_MAX_COMPONENTS if
   12611              :  * the colorant is not being used due to a SeparationOrder device parameter.
   12612              :  * It returns a negative value if not found.
   12613              :  */
   12614              : static int
   12615            0 : pdf14_spot_get_color_comp_index(gx_device *dev, const char *pname,
   12616              :     int name_size, int component_type, int num_process_colors, int cmyk)
   12617              : {
   12618            0 :     pdf14_device *pdev = (pdf14_device *)dev;
   12619            0 :     gx_device *tdev = pdev->target;
   12620            0 :     gs_devn_params *pdevn_params = &pdev->devn_params;
   12621            0 :     gs_separations *pseparations;
   12622            0 :     int comp_index;
   12623            0 :     dev_proc_get_color_comp_index(*target_get_color_comp_index);
   12624            0 :     int offset;
   12625              : 
   12626            0 :     while (tdev->child) {
   12627              :         tdev = tdev->child;
   12628              :     }
   12629              :     /* If something has gone wrong and this is no longer the pdf14 compositor, */
   12630              :     /* get the devn_params from the target to avoid accessing using the wrong  */
   12631              :     /* pointer. Bug 696372.                                                    */
   12632            0 :     if (tdev == (gx_device *)pdev)
   12633            0 :         pdevn_params = dev_proc(pdev, ret_devn_params)(dev);
   12634            0 :     offset = pdevn_params->num_std_colorant_names - num_process_colors;
   12635            0 :     pseparations = &pdevn_params->separations;
   12636              :     /* If num_process_colors is 3 or 1 (RGB or Gray) then we are in a situation

   12638              :      * have a spot colorant.  If the spot colorant name is Cyan, Magenta
   12639              :      * Yellow or Black, then we should use the alternate tint transform */

   12645              :         }

   12648            0 :     target_get_color_comp_index = dev_proc(tdev, get_color_comp_index);

   12657              :             ((pdf14_clist_device *)pdev)->saved_target_get_color_comp_index;

   12663            0 :     if (!pdev->overprint_sim && (component_type == NO_COMP_NAME_TYPE_HT ||

   12665            0 :             if (target_get_color_comp_index != NULL)
   12666            0 :                 return  (*target_get_color_comp_index)(tdev, pname, name_size, component_type);
   12667              :             else
   12668              :                 return -1;
   12669              :     }
   12670            0 :     if (pdev->overprint_sim && component_type == NO_COMP_NAME_TYPE_HT) {

   12678            0 :     comp_index = check_pcm_and_separation_names(dev, pdevn_params, pname,

   12682              :      * This is a decision we take here to avoid problems with PDFI not
   12683              :      * counting such colorants as spots. */
   12684            0 :     if (comp_index < 0 && dev->color_info.polarity == GX_CINFO_POLARITY_ADDITIVE) {

   12709              :     /*

   12711              :     * compensating of blend color space.

   12713            0 :     if (comp_index >= 0)
   12714            0 :         return comp_index - offset;
   12715              : 
   12716              :     /* Only worry about the target if we are not doing an overprint simulation */
   12717            0 :     if (!pdev->overprint_sim) {
   12718              :         /*

   12720              :         * Note that if the target device has ENABLE_AUTO_SPOT_COLORS this will add
   12721              :         * the colorant so we will only get < 0 returned when we hit the max. for
   12722              :         * the target device.
   12723              :         */
   12724            0 :         if (target_get_color_comp_index != NULL)
   12725            0 :             comp_index = (*target_get_color_comp_index)(tdev, pname, name_size, component_type);
   12726              :         else
   12727              :             return -1;
   12728              :         /*
